a republic

republican government―republicanism
共和政体
the republican form of government―republicanism
共和制度、共和主義
republicanism
共和党
the republican party―(米国のは)―the Republicans
共和党員
a Republican

content.content: きょうわらべ〔京童〕

content:
きょえい〔虚栄〕
〈名〉Vanity

content.content: 虚栄の巷
the Vanity Fair

content:
きょえいしん〔虚栄心〕
〈名〉Vanity; vainglory

content.content: 女は虚栄心が強い
Women are vain creatures.
あの男は虚栄心が強い
He is a vain fellow―a vainglorious man.
虚栄心に駆られる
to be impelled by vanity
虚栄心に駆られて悪事を働く女がある
Vanity impels some women to crime.
虚栄心を脱しなければ人は偉くなれぬ
A man can not attain greatness unless he rises above vanity.
虚栄心を養う
to foster one's vanity
虚栄心を挑発する
to pique one's vanity
虚栄心を満たす
to gratify one's vanity―tickle one's vanity―cater for one's vanity―pander to one's vanity

content:
ぎょえん〔御苑〕
〈名〉An Imperial garden

content.content: 御苑は衆庶の拝観を許さる
The Imperial gardens are opened to the public.

content:
きょか〔挙家〕
〈名〉The whole family; all one's people

content.content: この縁談には挙家の反対がある
All his people are opposed to the match.

content:
きょか〔許可〕
〈名〉Permission; leave; licence:(=する) to permit (one to do something); to give (one) leave (to do something); to license (one to sell liquor)

content.content: 許可を乞う
to ask permission―beg leave
先生に許可を乞うたか
Have you asked permission of your teacher?
その筋の許可を乞う
to apply to the authorities for permission
その筋の許可を得る
to obtain permission of the authorities
その筋の許可を得て学校を開いた
The school was opened by permission of the authorities.
誰の許可を得てこの金を使ったか
By whose permission did you appropriate the fund?
そうしてよろしいという許可があった、許可が無かった
I was permitted―not permitted―to do so.
許可になった
Permission was given―Permission was granted.
許可にならなかった
Permission was denied―Permission was refused.
図書館にては来月十日より公衆の閲覧を許可せらる
The library will be opened to the public on and after the 10th prox.

法廷で虚偽の申立をしては為にならぬぞ
It will be against your interests to make a false statement in court.
虚偽の取引(空取引)
a fictitious transaction

content.content: にしんの漁期
the season for herring fishing―the herring-fishing season

ぎょぎょう〔漁業〕
〈名〉Fishing industry; fishery

content.content: 沿海漁業
longshore fisheries
遠洋漁業
deep-sea fisheries―pelagic fisheries

〈名〉A fishing right; common of piscary

〈名〉Fishing grounds

content:
きょきん〔拠金〕
〈名〉
1. (=金を出し合うこと)clubbing together:(=する) to club together

content.content: 会員が拠金して端艇を買った
The members clubbed together to buy a boat―clubbed for a boat.

content: 2. (=寄付金)a contribution; a subscription:(=する) to contribute (towards the expenses); to subscribe (to the fund)

content.content: 各自応分の拠金をした
Each contributed his share―gave his mite―towards the object.

content: 3. (=寄付金を募ること)a collection:(=する) to take up a collection; to collect contributions; to raise a subscription; to make up a purse; to send round the hat (for some one)

content.content: 友人らから拠金して遺族に贈った
A subscription was raised―A purse was made up―among his friends for the bereaved family.
乗客が拠金して不幸な人に贈った
The passengers sent round the hat for the unfortunate man.

content:
きょく〔局〕
〈名〉
1. (=何省の何局)a bureau; an office; a board

content.content: 県治局
the Prefectural Bureau
郵便局
a post office
商務局
the Board of Trade
局長
the chief of a bureau―the director of a bureau
局員
the staff of a bureau
私も局員です
I am on the staff of the bureau.

content:
2. (=電話交換局)the telephone exchange
3. (=囲碁の勝負)a game at go
4. (=事局、時局、難局)an affair; the situation

content.content: 局に当たる
(事局なら)to take charge of an affair―concern oneself with an affair―(時局なら)―deal with the situation―(難局なら)―cope with the situation―grapple with the situation―tackle the situation
僕は自ら局に当たることを欲せぬ
I do not wish to concern myself with the affair.
この局に当たる者は無いか
Is there no one who can deal with the situation?―cope with the situation?―grapple with the situation?―tackle the situation?
彼は財政の局に当たっている
He has charge of the finances―He is in charge of the finances.
局に当たる者
those in charge―those in power―the authorities
局に当たる者は迷う
“Men are blind in their own cause”―“No man is wise in his own affairs.”

content: 5. (=結局)an end; a close; a termination; a conclusion; a settlement

content.content: 局を結ぶ
to end―come to an end―come to a close―come to a termination―come to a conclusion―come to a settlement
事件は首尾好く局を結んだ
The affair has been brought to a happy termination.
速かに局を結ばんことを祈る
I wish the matter may be brought to a speedy conclusion.
事は平和に局を結んだ
The affair has come to a peaceful termination―been brought to an amicable settlement.

content:
きょく〔曲〕
〈名〉
1. (=曲直の曲)wrong

content.content: いずれが直いずれが曲なるかを知らず
I do not know which is in the right and which is in the wrong―I do not know the rights and wrongs of the case.

content: 2. (=楽曲)a musical composition; a piece of music; a tune; an air

content.content: ピアノの一曲を奏す
to play a tune on the piano

content: 3. (=興味)interest; enjoyment; pleasure

content.content: 今時の芝居は曲が無い
Modern plays are devoid of interest.
逢ってすぐ別れるとは曲が無い
To meet only to part again is no pleasure.
一時に皆貰ってしまっては曲が無い
To receive all at a time would spoil the pleasure of expectation.

content:
きょく〔曲〕
〈接続詞〉Fancy-; trick-

content.content: 曲弾き
fancy-playing (on the samisen)
曲乗り
trick-riding―fancy-riding―(自転車なら)―trick-cycling―(飛行機なら)―a fancy flight
曲独楽
trick-spinning

content:
きょく〔極〕
〈名〉
1. (=南北極の極)a pole

content.content: 両極
the poles
北極、南極
the North pole―the South Pole
磁極
the magnetic poles
陽極
the positive pole―the anode
陰極
the negative pole―the cathode

content: 2. (=極点)the extreme; the top; the height; the zenith; the meridian; a climax:(最低点、どん底は)the bottom; the nadir; the worst

content.content: そんなことをするのは愚の極だ
It is the height of folly―folly itself―to do such a thing.
見せるのは残酷の極だ
To show it to him is the height of cruelty―cruelty itself.
行くのは無謀の極だ
To go would be the height of rashness―rashness itself.
学位を取るくらいが彼らの大望の極だ
It is the top of their ambition to take a degree.
俗人に言わせると熱心は野暮の極だ
Worldly men will say that enthusiasm in the height of vulgarity.
英国は繁栄の極に達している
England is at the summit of her prosperity―at the zenith of her prosperity.
その頃平家は栄華の極に達していた
Then the Taira family was at the meridian of its splendour.
彼は不運の極に達している
He is at the bottom of Fortune's wheel―His fortune is at its nadir.
窮状その極に達している
They are reduced to the last extreme of wretchedness.
不景気も極に達すると直る
When things are at their worst, they will mend.
あの頃は道徳の廃頽はその極に達した
In those days, the depravity of morals was at its worst.
彼の熱心は極に達した
His enthusiasm has reached its climax.

content: 3. (=何々の結果)［注意］訳語一定せず。

content.content: 彼は絶望の極自害した
Despair drove him to suicide.
苦心の極成功した
He succeeded after much labour―His labours were crowned with success.
放蕩の極身を亡ぼした
His riotous living ended in his ruin.
その極彼を殺すに至った
They went so for as to kill him―went the length of killing him.
節倹の極灯火までも倹約するに至った
He carried his economy so far as to do without a lamp―He carried his economy to the length of doing without a lamp.

〈名〉
1. (=玉髄)chalcedony
2. (=卵)an egg
3. (=玉代)the hire, the time-charge (of a woman of the town)

きょくがい〔局外〕
〈名〉The outside:(=の) outside; external

content.content: 局外に立つ
to stand outside
局外から見る
to observe from the outside
局外者
an outsider―the man in the street

きょくがいしゃ〔局外者〕
〈名〉An outsider; the man in the street

content.content: 局外者としては勝手な熱も吹けるがさて局に当たってみるとそうはいかぬ
An outsider may say what he likes, but not so with the man in power.
局外者の意見も聴く必要がある
Outside opinions are to be noted―The man in the street must be consulted.

きょくがいちゅうりつ

content.content: 局外中立を宣言する
to proclaim neutrality
局外中立を守る
to observe neutrality
局外中立を破る
to violate neutrality
僕は局外中立だ
I shall stand neutral.

〈名〉Prostitution of learning

content.content: 曲学阿世の徒
debauched writers who prostitute learning to pander to the corrupt public―literary sycophants

きょくげい〔曲芸〕
〈名〉A feat; a stunt; a trick; a fancy performance

content.content: 馬上の曲芸
equestrian feats―trick-riding―fancy-riding
自転車の曲芸
trick-cycling
飛行機の曲芸
a fancy flight
飛行家が種々の曲芸を演じた
The aviator performed several stunts.

content:

〈名〉Limits; bounds

content.content: 極限を越す
to go beyond bounds
極限を越さぬ
to keep within bounds
極限点
a limiting point
極限値
a limiting value

きょくげんする〔極言する〕
〈自動〉To go the whole length of the expression; to go so far as to say; to go the length of saying; not to mince matters

content.content: 彼は国賊なりとまで極言した
They went the length of calling him a traitor to his country―They denounced him as a traitor.
極言すれば詐欺だ
Without mincing matters, let us call it fraud.

ぎょくこう〔玉工〕
〈名〉A lapidary

きょくごま〔曲独楽〕
〈名〉Top-spinning tricks; trick-spinning

content:

〈名〉A throne; a chair of state

content.content: 正面に玉座を設ける
A throne is erected in front.

〈名〉Limits; bounds

content:

〈名〉The rising sun

content.content: 彼は旭日冲天の勢いだ
His star is in the ascendant―He is a rising man.
旭日章
the Order of the Rising Sun
旭日大綬章
the Grand Cordon of the Rising Sun
旭日旗
the rising-sun flag―the sun-flag

〈名〉High-angle fire:(=する) to fire at a high angle

きょくしゃく〔曲尺〕

ぎょくせききょうふん

ぎょくせきこんこう〔玉石混淆〕
〈名〉An indiscriminate mixture; a medley of good and bad; thread and thrum:(=の) indiscriminate

content:
きょくせきする〔跼蹐する〕
〈自動〉To find the world too narrow to hold one

content.content: 小天地に跼蹐する
to be pent up within a narrow sphere―to be “cabined cribbed confined.”

content:
きょくせつ〔曲折〕
〈名〉Crookedness; turns and twists; vicissitudes; intricacies; complications:(=する) to be crooked; to turn and twist

content.content: 曲折のある通り
a crooked street
曲折の多い筋道
an intricate plot
筋道の曲折
the intricacies of a plot
事件の曲折
the complications of an affair
曲折の多い事件
a complicated affair
人生の曲折
the vicissitudes of life―the ups and downs of life
曲折の多い生涯
a chequered career
談判には種々の曲折があった
The negotiations were marked by many twists and turns.
談判のまとまるまでには幾多の曲折があった
There was much parleying before the negotiations were settled.

きょくせん〔曲線〕
〈名〉A curved line; a curve

きょくせんび〔曲線美〕
〈名〉The line of beauty; the grace of curvature:(婦人の姿の曲線美は)tournure; the grace of tournure

きょくそく〔局束〕
〈名〉Restriction; restraint

content:
きょくだい〔極大〕
〈名〉Maximum

content.content: 極大と極小
maximum and minimum

content:
ぎょくたい〔玉体〕
〈名〉The Emperor's person or health

content.content: 玉体の安康を祈る
We pray for His Majesty's good health.

ぎょくだい〔玉代〕
〈名〉The hire, the time-charge (of a woman of the town)

content:
きょくたん〔極端〕
〈名〉An extreme:(=の) extreme; excessive; ultra; radical:(=に) to an extreme; to the extreme degree; to excess; too far

content.content: 極端に走る
to run to an extreme―go to extremes―go to excess―go too far―carry anything to excess―carry anything too far
人は極端に走りやすい
We are apt to go to extremes.
反対の極端に走る
to run to the opposite extreme―go from one extreme to the other
反対の極端に走らないように注意しなければならぬ
We must be careful not to run to the opposite extreme―not to go from one extreme to the other.
節倹もよいがそりゃちと極端だ
Frugality is all very well, but that is going too far―carrying the matter too far.
彼は夜間灯火を倹約するほどの極端な節約家だ
He goes so far as to do without a lamp―goes the length of doing without a lamp.
僕はそんな極端なことはせぬ
I will not go so far―go that length.
そりゃ極端論だ
Yours is an extreme view―a radical view.
君の議論は極端に論ずれば過激主義になる
Your argument, pushed to its extreme, becomes Bolshevism.
これは極端の例だ
This is an extreme case.
両極端の中を取る
to take the (golden) mean between two extremes―steer between Scylla and Charybdis
両極端相会す
Extremes meet.
極端論、極端主義
extremism―ultraism―radicalism
極端家、極端論者、極端主義者
an extremist―an ultraist―a radical

きょくち〔極地〕
〈名〉The polar regions

content:
きょくち〔極致〕
〈名〉Climax; culmination; consummation; ideal perfection

content.content: 美の極致に達する
to attain the ideal perfection of beauty
詩は文字の極致なり
Poetry is the crown of literature.

content:
きょくちょう〔局長〕
〈名〉The chief of a bureau; the director of a bureau

content.content: 郵便局長
a postmaster

きょくちょう〔曲調〕
〈名〉A melody

content:
きょくちょく〔曲直〕
〈名〉Right or wrong; the rights or wrongs (of a case); the merits (of a case)

content.content: 事の曲直がまだ判明せず
The rights and wrongs of the case are as yet unknown.
事の曲直を明らかにしなければならぬ
We must inquire into the merits of the case.
曲直を争う
to dispute about the rights and wrongs―dispute the point―contest the point
あの人はうるさく曲直を論じる
He troubles me with his rights and wrongs.

content:
きょくてん〔極点〕
〈名〉
1. (=極み)the extreme point; the highest point; the culminating point; the highest potential; a climax

content.content: 彼の熱心は極点に達した
His enthusiasm has reached a climax.
熱心が極点に達して狂気になった
His enthusiasm has culminated in madness.
蒸気の利用は極点に達している
The utilization of steam has reached its highest potential.

content: 2. (=頂点)the summit; the zenith; the meridian:(最低点、どん底は)the bottom; the nadir; the worst

content.content: 英国は繁栄の極点に達している
England is at the summit of her prosperity―at the zenith of her glory―at the meridian of her prosperity.
彼は不運の極点に達している
He is at the bottom of Fortune's wheel―His fortune is at its nadir.
不景気も極点に達すると直る
When things are at their worst, they will mend.
あの頃は道徳の廃頽は極点に達した
In those days, the depravity of morals was at its worst.

content:
きょくど〔極度〕
〈名〉
1. (=極み)The highest degree; the utmost; the extreme; a culmination; the highest possibility; the highest potential

content.content: 蒸気の利用は極度に達している
The utilization of steam has reached its highest potential.
彼の熱心は極度に達した
His enthusiasm has reached a climax.
熱心が極度に達して狂気になった
His enthusiasm has culminated in madness.
彼は極度の神経衰弱にかかっている
His is an extreme case of nervous prostration.
彼は極度の節倹を行っている
He lives with the utmost frugality.

content: 2. (=極点)the summit; the zenith; the meridian; a climax:(最低点、どん底は)the bottom; the nadir; the worst

content.content: 英国は繁栄の極度に達している
England is at the summit of her prosperity―at the zenith of her prosperity―at the meridian of her prosperity.
彼は不運の極度に達している
He is at the bottom of Fortune's wheel―His fortune is at its nadir.
不景気も極度に達すると直る
When things are at their worst, they will mend.
あの頃は道徳の廃頽は極度に達した
In those days, the depravity of morals was at its worst.

content:
きょくとう〔極東〕
〈名〉The Far East

content.content: 日本は極東の平和の為に戦争をした
Japan has fought in the cause of the peace of the Far East.
極東問題
the Far-Eastern question
極東運動大会
the Far-Eastern Olympic games

content:
きょくどめ〔局留め〕
〈副〉To be left till called for; post restante

content.content: 旅行中は手紙を局留めにして出して下さい
When I am on a journey, please address your letters to me post restante.

ぎょふ〔漁夫〕
〈名〉A fisherman

content.content: 鷸蚌{いつぼう}の争いは漁夫の利となる
The fight between the bird and the shell-fish ends in the fisherman's profit.
漁夫の利を得る
When two dogs fight for a bone, a third runs away with it―When two men quarrel, a third party gets the benefit.
(人を争わして)漁夫の利を得る
to play off one person against another―play off party against party

content:
ぎょふく〔魚腹〕
〈名〉A fish's belly

content.content: 魚腹を肥やす、魚腹に葬らる
to become food for the fishes―feed the fishes

content:
きょぶん〔虚聞〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: きょほう〔虚報〕

きょほう〔巨砲〕
〈名〉A monster gun

content:
きょほう〔虚報〕
〈名〉A false report; a groundless rumour; a false alarm; a canard

content.content: 虚報を伝える
to circulate a false report―give a false alarm―“cry wolf.”
その評判は虚報と判明した
The report proved false―turned out false.
戦時の虚報は上海から出る
War canards proceed from Shanghai.

きょぼう〔虚妄〕
〈名〉Falsehood; untruth:(=の) false; untrue

content:
きよほうへん〔毀誉褒貶〕
〈名〉Praise and censure; opinion; criticism

content.content: 彼は毀誉褒貶を意に介せぬ
He is indifferent to praise or censure―indifferent to the opinion of the public.
毀誉褒貶を意に介しては大事は為せぬ
One who is sensitive to criticism , can not do great things.

content:
きょまん〔巨万〕
〈名〉Millions

content.content: 巨万の財を積む
to amass millions
巨万の財を有す
He is worth millions―He rolls in riches―rolls in wealth―rolls in money―rolls in dollars.
彼が巨万の財を投じた事業だ
It is an enterprise on which he has spent millions.

content:
きょむ〔虚無〕
〈名〉Nothingness; nihility

content.content: 虚無主義
nihilism

content:
きょむとう〔虚無党〕
〈名〉The Nihilists

content.content: 虚無党員
a Nihilist

content:
きよめ〔清め〕
〈名〉Purification:(=る) to purify (the heart from or of sin); to cleanse (the hands from stain); to purge (the heart from or of sin)

content.content: 空気を清める
to purify the atmosphere
身体を清める
to cleanse the body
身体を洗い清める
to perform ablutions
心を清める
to purify one's heart―purge one's heart―(from sin)
手を清める
to wash one's hands
食後ビールを飲んで後口を清める
to wash down one's dinner with a glass of beer

content:
きょめい〔虚名〕
〈名〉An empty name; an empty title; a false reputation

content.content: 虚名を博す
to win a false reputation

ぎょめいぎょじ〔御名御璽〕
〈名〉The Imperial sign manual and seal

きょもう〔虚妄〕
〈名〉Falsehood; untruth:(=の) false; untrue

きょよう〔挙用〕
〈名〉Promotion; preferment:(=する) to promote, prefer (a person to some office)

きょよう〔許容〕
〈名〉
1. (=許認)permission; admission:(=する) to permit; to admit
2. (=抱容)toleration; tolerance:(=する) to tolerate (Christianity, etc.)
3. (=容赦)pardon; forgiveness:(=する)to pardon; to forgive

きょらい〔去来〕
〈名〉Recurrence:(=する) to recur to one's mind; to come and go

content:
ぎょらい〔魚雷〕
〈名〉A torpedo; a fish-torpedo

content.content: 魚雷発射管
a torpedo-tube

content:
きよらか〔清らか〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: きよい〔清い〕

ぎょらん〔魚卵〕
〈名〉(まだ産まないのは)roe:(産んだのは)spawn

content:
きょり〔巨利〕
〈名〉An enormous profit

content.content: 彼はこの事業で巨利を博した
He realized an enormous profit―made a fortune―by this enterprise.

content:
きょり〔距離〕
〈名〉
1. Distance

content.content: 距離を測る
to measure the distance
距離を目測する
to measure the distance with the eye
大砲の音は五十マイルの距離で聞こえる
A gun may be heard at a distance of 50 miles.
爆発の音は六十マイルの距離で聞こえた
The explosion was heard for a distance of 60 miles.
この信号はよほどの距離から見える
The signal is visible from a considerable distance.
地球から月までの距離はいくらあるか
What is the distance―How far is it―from the earth to the moon?
向こう側までの距離はいくらあるか
What is the distance across?―How far across is it?
運賃は距離によって違う
The carriage varies with the distance.
乗車賃は距離で定めてある
The fares are regulated by distance.
長距離、遠距離
a long distance
短距離、近距離
a short distance
長距離電話
long-distance telephone

content: 2. (=弾着距離)range; gunshot

content.content: 敵は弾着距離以内に在り、弾着距離以外に在り
The enemy is within range―within gunshot―out of range―out of gunshot.
五マイルの距離で砲火を開いた
We opened fire at a range of five miles.
遠距離で砲火を開いた
We opened fire at long range.
遠距離砲戦
a fight at long range―long bowels
近距離で敵を攻撃した
We attacked the enemy at short range―at close range.
近距離戦
a fight at close range―close quarters
距離を保つ
to maintain a range

content: 3. (=懸隔)interval

content.content: 木は二間ずつ距離を置いて植えてある
The trees stand at intervals of 12 feet.
一定の距離を置いて人を配る
to place the men at regular intervals
番兵は十間ずつ距離を置いて配ってある
The guards are placed at intervals of twenty yards.
双方の意見にはだいぶ距離がある
There is a wide interval between the opinions of the two.

content:
きょりゅう〔居留〕
〈名〉Residence:(=する) to reside

content.content: 居留外人
a foreign resident―a resident foreigner
居留民
the residents
居留民団
a settlement corporation

きょりゅうち〔居留地〕
〈名〉A settlement; a concession

content:
ぎょりょう〔漁猟〕
〈名〉Fishing

content.content: 漁猟に行く
to go fishing―go on a fishing expedition

ぎょりょうば〔漁猟場〕
〈名〉Fishing grounds

content:
ぎょるい〔魚類〕
〈名〉Fish; the finny tribe

content.content: 日本の沿海は魚類に富む
The seas about Japan teem with fish.

content:
きょれい〔虚礼〕
〈名〉Empty forms; formalities

content.content: 世が変われば礼儀は虚礼となる
As the times change, ceremonies remain as empty forms.
礼儀は虚礼に流れやすい
Ceremonies are apt to degenerate into formalities.
世の虚礼
conventional fiction―polite fiction
虚礼を廃す
Empty forms are dispensed with.

content:
キョロキョロ
〈副〉With restless eyes:(=する) to stare

content.content: 彼は始終目をキョロキョロしている
He has restless eyes.
キョロキョロ眺める
to stare at anything
人の顔をキョロキョロ眺めるのは失礼だ
It is bad manners to stare at people.
彼はキョロキョロ眺めてばかりいる
He is all eyes.
お前はキョロキョロするからどこへも連れて行けない
I can not take you anywhere, because you stare.
何をキョロキョロしているんだ
What are you staring around for?
キョロキョロ眼で捜す
to peer into corners―pry into secrets―pry about for valuables

content:
ぎょろぎょろする〔ギョロギョロする〕
〈自他動〉To goggle

content.content: 目がギョロギロする
One's eyes goggle.
目をギョロギョロさせる
to goggle one's eyes

content:
ぎょろぎょろする〔ギョロギョロする〕
〈自他動〉To goggle

content.content: 目がギョロギロする
One's eyes goggle.
目をギョロギョロさせる
to goggle one's eyes

content:
きよわい〔気弱い〕
〈形〉Timid; timorous; faint-hearted; chicken-hearted

content.content: 女は気弱い
Women are timorous.
気弱い男だ
What a faint-hearted man!

content:
きら〔綺羅〕
〈名〉A fine dress; fine clothes; finery

content.content: 綺羅を飾る
to dress finely―dress oneself out―trick oneself out―flaunt in finery
この辺の人は綺羅を飾る、綺羅を飾らない
People here are finely dressed―plainly dressed.
彼女は金にあかして綺羅を飾る
She gets herself up regardless of expense.

content:
きらい〔嫌い〕
〈名〉
1. (=嫌悪)dislike; aversion; antipathy; abhorrence; distaste; disinclination; hatred; prejudice:(動詞に訳せば)to dislike; to hate; to abhor; to detest; to loathe; to be averse to (anything); to have a dislike to (anything); to have an aversion to (anything); to have an antipathy to (anything); to have an abhorrence to (anything); to have a distaste for (anything); to have a disinclination for (anything); to have a hatred for (anything); to have a prejudice against (anything):(=な) not to one's liking; not to one's taste

content.content: 僕は偽君子が嫌いだ
I dislike hypocrites―I have a dislike to hypocrites―I hate hypocrites―I have a hatred for hypocrites.
僕はこの文章が嫌いだ
I do not like this style―This style is not to my liking―not to my taste.
僕は物事を半途にすることが嫌いだ
I hate to do things by halves.
数学が嫌いな人がある
Some people have a distaste for mathematics.
この子は学問が嫌いだ
The boy has a disinclination for study.
学問が嫌いで困る
He can not get over his dislike to study.
あの人は女が嫌いだ
He hates women―He has a hatred for women―He is a woman-hater―a misogynist.
あの女は男が嫌いだ
She is a man-hater.
彼は仕事が大嫌いだ
He is averse to work―He has an aversion to work―Work is his aversion.
彼は人に礼を言われるのが殊に嫌いだ
Being thanked is my pet aversion.
僕はあの人が大嫌いだ
I have an antipathy to that man―I can not bear him.
僕は手術が大嫌いだ
I have an abhorrence to surgical operations―Surgical operations are abhorrence to my feelings―I have a horror of the knife.
彼は西洋嫌いだ
He has a prejudice against things Western―He is prejudiced against foreign things.
人には皆好き嫌いがある
Everybody has his likes and dislikes.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 彼は社会主義が大嫌いだ
He is an enemy to socialism.
(彼だって人間だもの)酒と女は嫌いじゃない
He is no enemy to wine and woman.
彼に言われることが大嫌いだ
What he says, is gall and wormwood to me.
あの西洋人は日本嫌いだ
He is anti-Japanese (in his sentiments).

content: 2. (=欠点)a fault

content.content: この本は緻密に過ぎるのきらいがある
This book has the fault of excessive minuteness.
フランス人はていねい過ぎるのきらいがある
The French have the fault of excessive politeness.
お役所の事務は繁文褥礼のきらいがある
Office-business is open to the charge of red-tapism.

content:
きらう〔嫌う〕
〈他動〉
1. To dislike; to hate; to abhor; to detest; to loathe; to have a dislike to (a person); to have an aversion to (work); to have an antipathy to (cats); to have an abhorrence to (pain); to have a hatred for (foreigners); to have a distaste for (mathematics); to have a disinclination for (study); to have a prejudice against (Christianity, etc.)

content.content: 皆あの人を蛇蝎の如くに嫌っている
They detest him.
げじげじのように嫌っている
They loathe him.
寒けを立てて嫌っている
They abhor him―He is abhorrent to them.
生徒はあの先生を嫌って困る
The boys have an antipathy to that man.
猫を嫌う人がある
Some people have an antipathy to cats.
まだキリスト教を嫌う老人がある
Some old people still have a prejudice against Christianity―Some old people are still prejudiced against Christianity.
彼は人に嫌われる
He is disliked by people―shunned by everybody―odious to people.
そんなことをすると人に嫌われるぞ
Such conduct will make you odious to people.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: あの人は人と交際することを嫌う
He shuns society―He keeps to himself.
彼らは時を嫌わずやって来る
They come at all hours―at all sorts of hours.
彼は場合を嫌わずしゃれる
He is witty in season and out of season.
能書筆を嫌わず
“The cunning workman does not quarrel with his tool.”
出ものはれものところ嫌わず
“Necessity knows no law.”

content: 2. (=女が男を嫌う)to reject (a man); to refuse (a man)

content.content: 彼はある婦人に結婚を申込んで嫌われた
He proposed to a lady, who refused him.
あの細君はご亭主を嫌っている
She does not love her husband.
あまりしつこくすると女に嫌われるぞ
Your importunity will drive away your mistress.
(盃を差して)嫌われた
He will not accept my cup.

content:
きらきら〔煌々〕
〈副〉(=する) (gold and silver) glitter; (dewdrops) glisten; (gems) sparkle; (stars) twinkle; (distant lights) scintillate

content.content: 空には星がキラキラ光っている
The stars are twinkling in the sky.
金の鯱{しゃちほこ}が日光にキラキラ光っている
The golden grampuses are glittering in the sun.
砂が月光にキラキラ光る
Sand glistens in the moonlight.

ぎらぎらする〔ギラギラする〕
〈自動〉(Of light too strong) to glare
〈形〉Garish (light)

ぎらぎらする〔ギラギラする〕
〈自動〉(Of light too strong) to glare
〈形〉Garish (light)

content:
きらく〔気楽〕
〈形〉
1. (=呑気)easy (life); easy-going (man) lights-hearted (man); careless (bachelor); free from care:(=に) at one's ease

content.content: 独身生活は気楽だ
A bachelor's life is free from care.
彼は気楽な独身者だ
He is a careless bachelor.
気楽に暮らす
to lead a careless life―live an easy life―live at one's ease
彼は田舎に引込んで気楽に暮らしている
He lives an easy life in his country retreat.
気楽に働く
to work at one's ease―at one's leisure
彼は今日の仕事をすまして気楽にしている
He has finished his day's work, and is taking his ease.
君は昨夜の火事を知らないって、気楽を言ってら
Don't you know of last night's fire? You take takings easy.
君は気楽な人だ
You are an easy-going man.

content: 2. (=楽観的)optimistic (views); sanguine (nature, etc.)

content.content: 彼は気楽な質だ
He is of a sanguine nature―sanguine by nature.
前に試験を控えて気楽を言っている
He is sanguine of passing his examination.
どうも結果が案じられる、君のように気楽を言っては困る
You are too optimistic about the result.

content:
きらす〔切らす〕
〈他動〉
1. To run out of (money); to get out (the article, etc.)

content.content: 彼は小遣を切らしては借りに来る
He comes to me when he runs out of his pocket-money.
僕は金を切らした
I am out of money.
その品は切らしました(おあいにくさま)
We have run out of the article―We are out of the article―The article is out of stock.
お前に小遣を切らさせて気の毒だ
I am sorry to keep you out of your pocket-money.
お前に小遣を切らさせないようにしよう
I will keep you in pocket-money.
君に仕事を切らさせない
I will keep you in work.
息を切らす
to get out of breath―lose breath―lose wind
一人の男が息を切らして走って来た
A man came running himself out of breath.
君は息を切らしてしゃべっている
You have talked yourself out of breath.
酒が一升
What wine costs I care not―
千両しよと儘よ
A thousand ryo by Jove!
主の寝酒を
Your nightly sleeping draught
切らしゃせぬ
I'll never out of.
手にひびを切らす
to get one's hands chapped
足に赤切れを切らす
to get one's feet chapped

content:
ぎらつく〔ギラつく〕
〈自動、形〉→『

content.content: ぎらぎらする〔ギラギラする〕

content:
ぎらつく〔ギラつく〕
〈自動、形〉→『

content.content: ぎらぎらする〔ギラギラする〕

content:
きらぬ〔切らぬ〕
〈接尾動詞〉Can not; more than one can; before one can; before one finishes

content.content: この箱には入り切らない
The box can not hold them all―There are more than the box can hold.
この室に千人は入り切らない
This room can not seat a thousand―A thousand is more than this room can seat.
生徒が多くて教室に入り切らない
There are so many students that the class-room can not hold them all―There are more students than the class-room can hold.
僕が言い切らないうちに彼は行ってしまった
He was gone before I could say all.
本を読み切らないうちに持って行かれた
The book was taken from me before I had finished reading it.

content:
きらびやか〔綺羅びやか〕
〈形〉Gaudy; gorgeous

content.content: この社会の女はきらびやかに装っている
The women of this class are gaudily dressed―gorgeously dressed.

きらめき〔煌めき〕
〈名〉A glitter (of gold); glistening (of dewdrops); sparkling (of gems); twinkling (of stars); scintillation (of distant lights, etc.)

content:
きらめく〔煌めく〕
〈自動〉(Gold and silver) glitter; (dewdrops) glisten; (gems) sparkle; (stars) twinkle; (distant lights) scintillate

content.content: 空には星がきらめく
The stars twinkle in the sky.
金の鯱{しやちほこ}が日光にきらめいている
The golden grampuses are glittering in the sun.
砂が月光にきらめく
Sand glistens in the moonlight.

content:
ギラリ
〈副〉Flashing

content.content: ギラリと刀を抜く
to flash a blade

content:
きり〔奇利〕
〈名〉An unexpected profit; a godsend; a windfall

content.content: 奇利を博す
to make an unexpected profit―have a windfall

content:
きり〔斬り〕
〈接尾名詞〉Murder; destruction of life

content.content: 三人斬り
a triple murder
十人斬り
destruction of ten lives

content:
きり〔錐〕
〈名〉A gimlet

content.content: 錐をもむ
to use a gimlet between two hands
錐で木に穴を明ける
to make a hole in wood with a gimlet―gimlet wood

content:
きり〔切り〕
〈名〉
1. (=切れ目)a places to leave off

content.content: ここがちょうどきりが好い
This is a good place to leave off.

content: 2. (=際限)limits; bounds; end

content.content: 慾にはきりが無い
Avarice knows no bounds―There is no limit to avarice.
望めばきりが無い
There is no limit to desire.
あの男の無心はきりが無い
There is no end to his requests.
人の言うことを一々聞いていてはきりが無い
If you listen to everything people say, there will be no end to it.
くれくれするときりが無い
If you give everytime he asks, there will be no end to it.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 君の言うことを聞くと我も我もできりが無い
If I comply with your request, I shall be flooded with requests.
便々と待っていてはきりが無い
I can not wait for ever.
あの男の金を返すのを待っていてはきりが無い
If you wait for him to pay, you will have to wait for ever.
彼に言わしておくときりが無い
If you let him talk, he will go on talking to the end of time.
わがままをさせるときりが無い
If you let him have his own way, he will end by pulling the house about his cars.
上を見ればきりが無い
Greatness is comparative.

content:
〈副〉
1. (=だけ) all; only alone

content.content: 成功したのは一人きり
Only one man has succeeded.
成功したのは君きりだ
You are the only man who has succeeded―You alone have succeeded.
ある金はこれきりか
Is this all the money there is?―Is this all the money you have?
残っている金はこれきりだ
This is all the money there is left.
(皆行って)もう君と二人きりになった
We are alone.
君と僕と二人きりでたくさんだ
We two alone are enough.
後一週間切りだ
It will last only a week more.
今度きり説明する
I will explain once for all.

content: 2. (=だけ)(this is) all; (that was) the last

content.content: あれっきりもう無い
That was all I had―That was the last I had.
これきりもう無心をしない
This is the last request I shall make.
あれっきり会わない
That was the last I saw of him.
彼はあれっきり来ない
That was the last time he came.
今日きりでおしまいだ
This is the last day.
昨日きりでおしまいになった
Yesterday was the last.

content:
〈接尾詞〉
1. For good (and all); never to (do something again)

content.content: 今度は帰りきりに帰ったのだ
I have come home for good (and all).
彼は行ききりに行ったのだ
He has gone away for good and all.
彼は国を出たきり帰らない
He left home, never to return.
寝たっきり起きない
He lay down, never to rise again.
沈んだっきり浮かない
He sank beneath the waves, never to rise again.
取りっきりで返さない
He took it, never to return it.

content: 2. (=その後)since

content.content: それっきり会わない
I have not seen him since.

content: 〈接続詞〉Since

content.content: 彼は三年前に家出したきりなんの消息も無い
He has not been heard of since he left home three years ago.
彼には神戸で別れたきり会わない
I have not met him since I parted from him in Kobe.

content:
きり〔霧〕
〈名〉
1. Fog; mist

content.content: 霧が深い
The fog is dense―The fog is thick―It is foggy.
船が霧に包まれる
A ship is enveloped in a fog.
朝霧が立って山が隠れる
The hills are veiled in the morning mist.
霧が晴れる
The fog clears (off or up)―The fog lifts.
日が出て霧を払う
The sun dispels the fog.
霧はロンドンの名物
London is noted for her fogs.
霧のためになにも見えぬ
The fog prevents our seeing anything.

content: 2. (=吹く霧)spray

content.content: 霧を吹く
to blow a spray―spray water on―anything

content:
ぎり〔義理〕
〈名〉［注意］半ば英語を標準とす。
1. Duty

content.content: 友人に対して義理を立てる
to do one's duty by a friend―do the proper thing by a friend―(米国にては)―do the clean thing by a friend
これで友人に対する義理が立ったというものだ
I have done my duty by my friend.
義理を欠く
to fail in one's duty
それでは義理を立ちません
Then I shall fail in my duty.
義理にも恩人の肩を持たねばならぬ
I am in duty bound―It is my bounden duty―to side with my benefactor.
そんなことは義理としてできぬ
Duty forbids me to do such a thing.
彼の短所ばかり挙げて長所を挙げなくては義理がすまぬ
It is my duty to him―It is due to him―to mention his merits as well as his faults.
義理一片で(義理ずくで)世話をしてやったのだ
I helped him as a matter of duty.
義理と情けの煩悶
a struggle between love and duty
債権者に義理を立てる
to satisfy the creditor's claims

content: 2. Honour

content.content: 盗人同志にも義理がある
“Thieves have a sense of honour.”
今度こそ義理にも成功しなけりゃならぬ
I am in honour bound―on my honour―to succeed this time.
この金は受取れた義理じゃない
I can not, in honour, accept this money.
彼はその金を払うのが否だと言われた義理じゃあるまい
He can not, in honour, refuse to pay the money.
彼に義理の悪い借金がある
I owe him a debt of honour.

content: 3. Justice; fairness

content.content: (一人の頼みを聴いてやって)彼の頼みを聴いてやらなくては義理が悪い
It would be unjust―an act of injustice―not to grant his request as well.
それでは義理が悪い
That is not fair―All is not square.
義理を立てる
to do justice to anything
ご馳走には充分に義理を立てた(十二分に頂戴した)
We have done ample justice to the repast.

content: 4. Faith

content.content: 彼は義理が堅い
He is a faithful friend.

content: 5. Regard (for some one)

content.content: 彼は主人に対する義理でキリスト教を信じたのだ
He embraced Christianity out of regard for his master.

content: 6. Courtesy

content.content: 病気見舞いに行かなくては義理が悪い
I must go and inquire after his health for courtesy' sake.
義理で貸した金だ
I lent him the money for the sake of courtesy.

content: 7. Decency

content.content: あの経験家が義理にもそんな失錯はできない
A man of his experience can not, in common decency, commit such a blunder.

content: 8. Obligations

content.content: あなたには(お世話になった)義理があるからあなたのことなら何でも
I lie under obligations to you―You have laid me under obligations―and I can refuse you nothing.
(人を世話して)義理にからむ
to lay one under obligations―establish a claim on one's friendship
義理にからまるのはいやだ
I don't like to lie under obligations (to any one).
義理にからまって否と言えぬ
A sense of obligation forces me to comply.

content: 9. (=恩義)(a debt of) gratitude

content.content: 貴方には(お世話になった)義理があるからご恩を報じなければならぬ
I owe you a debt of gratitude.
人を義理でしばる
to bind a man to oneself by gratitude
あの方には義理がある(義理でしばられている)から去られぬ
I am bound to him by gratitude.
あの男は義理を知らぬ、義理知らずだ
He is insensible to kindness―ungrateful―an ingrate.

content: 10. (=浮世の義理)demands (of custom); shackles (of convention); bonds (of society); ties (of friendship); claims (on one's time); demands (on one's purse)

content.content: 浮世の義理
the demands of custom―the shackles of convention
義理すべをする
to satisfy the demands of custom
飽きも飽かれもせぬ仲を世間の義理ゆえ遠ざかる
We lovers must part to satisfy the demands of custom.
(贈答品の送って)義理をする
to conform to custom (by sending presents)
人の物で義理をする
to satisfy the demands of custom at another's expense―“rob Peter to pay Paul”
公人は世間の義理で暇つぶしをせねばならぬ(訪問、公会などで忙しい)
A public man has many claims on his time―demands on his time.
また世間の義理で物入りがある
He also has many claims on his purse―demands on his purse.
二人は義理ある仲だ
They are connected by ties of friendship.

content: 11. (=義理人情)justice and humanity; heart and conscience; human sympathy

content.content: 彼は義理も人情も知らぬ
He has no heart or conscience―He has no human sympathy.
法律に訴えるのは義理人情を捨ててのことだ
One must divest oneself of humanity before one can go to law―Law begins where human sympathy ends.

content: 12. (=義理合い、権利)a right; a claim

content.content: 君にこんなことを頼めた義理じゃない(ご無理を願ってすまぬ)
I have no right to make you such a request―no claim on your friendship―no claim on you.

content: 13. (=人倫の義理)artificial relationship

content.content: 義理ある兄(弟)

義理ある姉(妹)
a sister-in-law

content: 14. (=意義)meaning; signification

content.content: 義理通ぜず

content: 2. (=敵を切り払う)to clear (the land of the enemy)

to clear the land of the enemy

content:

2. (=開拓する)to clear

content.content: 荒地を切り開く
to clear waste land

content: 3. (=道を切り開く)to cut; to open

content.content: 道路を切り開く
to open a road
山を切り開く
to cut through a mountain
山を切り開いて鉄道を敷く
to lay a railway through a cut in the mountain

They fled by cutting their way through the enemy.

〈名〉A sprayer; an atomizer

content:

content.content: 切り札はハート
Hearts are trumps.
切り札を出す
to play a trump-card―trump
切り札で切る
to trump a card
切札でない札
a lay card

きりぼしだいこん〔切り干し大根〕
〈名〉Dried strips of radishes

content:
きりまくる〔切りまくる〕
〈名〉To slash about one

content.content: 縦横無尽に切りまくった
He slashed about him right and left.

content:

〈名〉Management

content.content: 彼は切りまわしがうまい
He is a good manager.

content:

〈自他動〉To manage (a state or a household); to manage matters

content.content: 彼はうまく切りまわす
He manages matters with skill―He is a good manager.
彼女は家の中を上手に切りまわす
She manages the household with skill.
勝手に切りまわしている
She carries matters with a high hand.

content.content: 二人は丁々発止と切り結んだ
They clashed swords with each other.

content.content: 魚に切り目をつける(汁の染み込むように)

content.content: 天下をきりもりする

to manage the affairs of a company

content:
きりゃく〔機略〕

content.content: 彼は機略に富んでいる
He is fertile in resources―full of resource.

a man of resources―a resourceful man

a temporary domicile
寄留届をする

content:
きりょう〔器量〕
〈名〉
1. (=縹緻)personal appearance; personal beauty; (good) looks; (a woman's) charms; (a man's) personal advantages

content.content: あの女は器量が好い
She is good-looking―well-favoured―pretty―beautiful.
器量が悪い
She is ill-favoured―plain―homely.
器量は姉に勝る
She is prettier than―more beautiful than―her sister.
器量は姉に劣る
She is less beautiful than―not so beautiful as―her sister.
器量は少し姉に劣る
She is not quite so beautiful as her sister.
器量は遠く姉に及ばず
She is not nearly so beautiful as her sister.
人並みすぐれた器量だ
She is beautiful beyond the run of women―of surpassing beauty―of singular beauty―of rare beauty.
器量は十人並み
She is a woman of passable charms―passably good-looking.
中肉中背器量は十人並み
She is of medium flesh and height, and passably good-looking.
彼女は器量自慢だ
She is vain of her good looks.
器量が好くなる
to improve in one's looks
あの娘は器量を上げた
She has improved.
器量が悪くなる
to lose one's good looks
彼女の器量は分けて目立つ
Her beauty stands out conspicuously.
器量に惚れて貰ったのだ
He married her for the sake of her charms.
器量好みをすると醜婦を娶る
“Go farther, and fare worse.”
器量は当座の花
“Beauty is a fragile good.”

content: 2. (=才能)abilities; talents; parts; capacity

content.content: 彼は器量人だ
He is a man of parts.
大事を為す器量を示した
He showed a capacity for great achievements.
人に将たるの器量は無い
He has no capacity for commanding.

content: 3. (=価値)estimation; dignity

content.content: 彼は器量を上げた
He has risen in the public estimation―(ある行動によってなら)―His conduct has raised him in the public estimation.
器量を下げた
He has fallen in the public estimation―sunk in the public estimation―(ある行動によってなら)―His conduct has lowered him in the public estimation―sunk him in the public estimation.
そんなことをしては器量が下がる
It would be beneath your dignity to do such a thing.

content:
ぎりょう〔伎倆〕
〈名〉Talent; ability; capacity

content.content: 伎倆のある人だ
He is a talented man―an able man―a capable man―a man of talent―a man of parts.
双方伎倆は互角だ
They are equal in ability.

content:
きりょく〔気力〕
〈名〉Energy; vigour; mettle; spirit; pith; go; push

content.content: 彼は気力家だ
He is an energetic man―a man of pith.
気力満々
He is full of energy―full of go―full of push and go.
気力に乏しい
He is deficient in energy―wanting in vigour.
事を為す気力が無い
He has no spirit to do.
気力が衰えた
His energy fails him.

content:
きりょく〔汽力〕
〈名〉Steam-power

content.content: この機械は汽力で運転する
The machine is moved by steam-power―driven by steam.
汽力起重機
a steam-crane

content:
きりん〔麒麟〕
〈名〉The giraffe; the camelopard

content.content: 麒麟も老いては駑馬に劣る
“A young dog is better than old lion.”

きりんじ〔麒麟児〕
〈名〉A prodigy; a phenomenon

content:
きる〔斬る〕
〈他動〉To cut (one with a sword); to cut off (one's head); to slay (the enemy)

content.content: 首を斬る
to cut off one's head―behead one―decapitate one
彼は近頃の改革で首を斬られた
He was dismissed―cashiered―in the late reorganization.
彼は肩先を斬られた
He was cut in the shoulder―cut across the shoulder.
一刀の下に斬り捨てた
I cut him down with one stroke of my sword.
奸臣を斬る
to slay the traitor

content:
きる〔切る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=刃物で切る)to cut (with a knife); to cut off (a finger); to clip (with scissors); to pare (to nail); to fell (a tree); to punch (a ticket)

content.content: 手を切った
I have cut my finger.
深く手を切る
to cut one's finger to the bone
小指を切る
to cut off one's little finger
髪を切る
to cut off one's hair
爪を切る
to pare one's nails
深爪切る
to pare a nail to the quick
木を切る
to cut down a tree―fell a tree
切符を切る
to punch a ticket
はさみでチョキリと切る
to clip anything (with scissors)
首を切る
to cut off one's head―behead one
彼は近頃の改革で首を切られた
He was dismissed―cashiered―in the late reorganization.
腹を切る
to disembowel oneself
今度成功しなかったら腹を切る
I will answer for my success with my life.
彼は肩先を切られた
He was cut in the shoulder.
ランプの心を切る
to trim the wick―trim the lamp
菓子を二つに切れ、半分に切れ
Cut the cake in two―Cut the cake in half.
肉を薄く切る
to cut the meat in slices
大根をさいの目に切る
to cut the radishes into cubes
ずたずたに切る
to hew a body to pieces―hack a body to pieces―hew and hack a body―hackle a body
糸を一尺切る
to cut a foot off a string
フランネルを一ヤール切る
to cut a yard off a piece of flannel
棒を一寸切る
to cut an inch off a stick
棒先を切る
to take commissions―squeeze―(米国では)―take graft
身を切られる
to have oneself cut
彼にそう言われると身を切られるようだ
His words cut me to the heart.
身を切られるよりも辛かった
It was more than flesh and blood could bear.

content: 2. (=刃物でなく切る)to cut

content.content: 肌を切るような北風
a cutting north-wind
カルタを切る
to cut cards―shuffle cards
切札で切る
to trump a card
行列を切る
to cut across a procession―get through a procession
道先を切る
to cross one's path
船が水を切る
A ship cleaves the water.
封を切る
to break the seal―open a letter
口を切る
to break the ice―broach a subject
野菜などを洗って水を切る
to strain the vegetables
火を切る
to strike sparks (with flint and steel)
縄を切る、糸を切る
(刃物でなら)to cut a rope―cut a string―(引張ってなら)―break a rope―snap a string
縄目を切る
to burst one's bonds
鎖を切る
to burst a chain
電話を切る
to ring off―(交換手が切れば)―disconnect the telephone
電話を切らずにおけ
Hold the telephone!―Hold connection!
日限を切る
to fix the time―set the date
手形を切る
to discount a note
金びらを切る、札びらを切る
to sport one's fortune

content: 3. (=手を切る、縁を切る)to cut connections with, sever connections with, break with (a person)

content.content: 女と手を切ってしまえ
Cut connections with her!
きれいさっぱりと手を切ってしまえ
Have done with her!
夫婦の縁を切る
to cut the marriage tie―dissolve the bonds of matrimony―break up conjugal relations
親子の縁を切るぞ
I will disown you (as a son)
兄弟の縁を切った
I have disowned him as a brother.
親類縁者と縁を切る
to cut loose from all ties
悪縁を切る
to disengage oneself from an evil association―cut loose from evil ties―fling off troublesome connections
切っても切れない悪縁だ
It is a fatal connection―a fatal attachment.
二人は切っても切れない仲だ
They are bound up in each other―inseparable.
(食卓で)肉などを切って配る
to carve fowl or meat

content:
きる〔切る〕
〈接続動詞〉To finish (doing something):(副詞に訳せば)completely; entirely

content.content: 読みきる
to finish reading
人をばかにしきっている
He is simply playing with me.
人を悔りきっている
He laughs me to scorn.
それは知れきったことだ
It is a well-known fact―a patent fact.
わかりきった誤りだ
It is an obvious mistake.

content:
きる〔着る〕
〈他動〉(常に着る)to wear:(着物をとって着る)to put on; to don; to get into (one's clothes)

content.content: 人間は着物を着る
Man wears clothing.
フランネルを肌に着る
to wear flannel next the skin
金持ちは絹を着る
The richer people wear silk.
(朝起きて)着物を着る
to put on one's clothes―get into one's clothes―dress oneself
早く着物を着給え
On with your clothes!―Into your clothes!
急いで着物を着た
I dressed myself in haste.
赤い着物を着る
to become a convict
彼は絹の着物を着ている
He is wearing silk clothes―He has silk clothes on―He is dressed in silk.
洋服を着ている
He has foreign clothes on―He is dressed in foreign clothes―He is in foreign clothes.
制服を着ている
He has a uniform on―He is in uniform.
新しい上衣を着ている
He has a new coat on―He is in a new coat.
立派な着物を着ている
He is (dressed) in fine clothes―finely dressed.
汚い着物を着ている
He is (dressed) in shabby clothes―shabbily dressed.
ボロを着ている
He is in rags―clad in rags.
将校は大礼服を着ている
The officers are in full dress.
着ている着物
the clothes I am wearing―the clothes I have on―the clothes on my back―the clothes I stand up in
今着ている上衣はよく合う
The coat I have on is a good fit.
彼は着ている着物までもはがれた
His very coat was taken off his back.
着ている着物を着替えずにそのままでお出で
Come in the clothes you stand up in.
寒いから外套を着て行き給え
Put on your overcoat, as it is cold.
何を着て行こう
What shall I go in?
着て行く着物が無い
I have nothing to go in.
外套を脱がずにそのまま着ておれ
Keep your overcoat on!―Keep on your overcoat!
彼は外套を着たままで入ってきた
He came in with his overcoat on―He entered in his overcoat.
着物を着たままで寝た
I slept in my clothes.
暑くて上衣を着ていられぬ
I can not keep my coat on, it is so hot.
この上衣を着てご覧
Try this coat on!―Try on this coat!
この柄なら三十まで着られる
This pattern can be worn by people of thirty.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: これはだいぶ着た上衣だ
The coat has seen much service.
子どもが大きくなって着物が着られなくなった
The boy has outgrown his clothes.
錦を着て故郷に帰る
to return home loaded with honours
親の威光を笠に着る
to shelter oneself under one's father's influence
親の威光を笠にきて威張っている
He holds up his head under the shelter of his father's influence.
親の威光を笠に着るものではない
You should stand on your own merits.

content:
きる〔被る〕
〈他動〉To wear

content.content: 罪を被る
to be charged with a crime―(自ら進んでなら)―take the guilt upon oneself
そうして下されば恩にきます
If you will do so, I shall consider myself under an obligation.

content:
キルク
〈名〉A cork

content.content: キルクを抜く

キルク抜き

きれ〔切れ〕
〈名〉
1. (=一片) a piece; a bit:(切った一片) a cut:(削いだ一片) a slice:(切れはし) a scrap:(細い切れ) a strip

content.content: 紙切れ
a piece of paper―a scrap of paper
パンの切れ
a piece of bread
西洋菓子の切れ

a slice of fish

content: 2. (=反物の切れはし)a piece of cloth

content.content: 寄せ切れ
odd pieces odd cloth

content:
きれあじ〔切れ味〕
〈名〉The cutting power (of a sword)

content.content: 刀の切れ味を試す
to see how a sword will cut―try a sword on some one
日本刀は切れ味が好い
A Japanese sword cuts clean.
切れ味の好い刀
a clean-cutting sword―a trenchant blade
日本刀の切れ味を見せてやろう
You shall fell the edge of a Japanese sword.
この小刀は切れ味が好さそうだ
The knife seems to cut well.

content:
きれい〔綺麗〕
〈形〉
1. (=美しい)beautiful; pretty; fine; nice; fair; delicate; gay

content.content: 綺麗な花
a pretty flower―a beautiful flower
綺麗な女
a beautiful woman―a pretty girl―a fair one
彼女は若い時は綺麗だったろう
She must have been a beauty in the day.
お婆さんは若い綺麗な人の引立て役
An old woman serves as a foil to the young and pretty.
あの娘は綺麗になった
She has improved in her looks.
綺麗な庭
a beautiful garden―a pretty garden a fine garden―a nice garden
お庭が綺麗になりました
The garden has improved in appearance.
綺麗な着物
fine clothes
綺麗な文章
a beautiful style
綺麗な言葉づかい
a delicate expression
土手は桜が咲くと綺麗です
The banks are gay in the cherry season.
さぞ綺麗でしたろう
What a sight it must have been!

content: 2. (=清潔)clean (hands); cleanly (habit); clear (water); pure (heart); neat (room); tidy (person, etc.)

content.content: 肌は垢を落として綺麗だ
The skin is clean from dirt.
水は芥が無くて綺麗だ
The water is clear from impurities.
お庭はいつも綺麗だ
The garden is kept clean.
座敷はいつも綺麗だ
The rooms are kept neat and tidy.
二人の関係は綺麗なものだ
Their relations are pure from sin.
心の綺麗な人だ
He has a pure heart―a beautiful soul.
金使いが綺麗だ
He is free with his money―generous with his money.

content:
きれいさっぱり〔綺麗さっぱり〕
〈副〉Clean; wholly; completely; entirely

content.content: きれいさっぱりと思い切ってしまえ(手を切ってしまえ)
Have done with her!

content:
きれいずき〔綺麗好き〕
〈形〉Cleanly; tidy; neat; dainty

content.content: 日本人は綺麗好きだ
The Japanese are a cleanly people.
細君は綺麗好きだ
His wife is a tidy woman.
綺麗好きな婦人はこんなことをさせない
A dainty lady would not allow such things.
彼は綺麗好きを越して潔癖だ
He is fastidious.

content:
きれいに〔綺麗に〕
〈副〉
1. (=美しく)beautiful; prettily; finely

content.content: 綺麗に装う
to dress finely
娘どもは綺麗に装っている
The girls are finely dressed.

content: 2. (=清潔に)clean; neatly; tidily

content.content: 庭が綺麗に掃除してある
The garden is kept clean.
座敷は綺麗にかたづいている
The room is kept neat and tidy.
座敷を綺麗に掃除してくれ
Sweep the room clean.
作文が綺麗に書いてある
The composition is neatly written.
遊ぶなら綺麗に遊べ
If you take your pleasure, leave a welcome behind you.
彼は綺麗に金を出した
He came down handsomely.
金を使うなら綺麗に使え
Be free with your money!
どうせ金を出すなら綺麗に出せ
If you give at all, give freely and willingly!

content: 3. (=全く)clean; wholly; completely; entirely

content.content: 金がきれいに無くなった
The money is clean gone.
彼はご馳走をきれいに食った
He licked the dish clean.
どうせ白状するならきれいに白状してしまえ
If you do confess, make a clean breast of it.
この金があれば借金がきれいにかたづきます
This money will clear me from my debts―free me from my debt.
日本は三十億の公債をきれいに償還した
Japan has redeemed her national loan of 3,000,000,000 (three billion) yen to the last cent.
勘定をきれいにすました
I have paid my accounts in full.
金をきれいに使ってしまった
I have gone through the money―worked through the money.
あんな女ときれいに手を切った方がよい
You had better cut loose from such a woman.
彼は表面は女ときれいに別れた
He is outwardly nothing to her now.

content:
きれぎれ〔切れ切れ〕
〈名〉Pieces; bits; shreds; scraps:(=に) to pieces

content.content: きれぎれに切る
to cut anything to pieces
手紙をきれぎれに裂いてしまった

きれくず〔切れ屑〕

content:
きれつ〔亀裂〕

content.content: 干ばつのために田に亀裂を生じた

地震のために地盤に亀裂を生じた所がある

content:
ぎれつ〔義烈〕
〈名〉Heroism

content.content: 日本軍の義烈に感ぜざるは無し

忠勇義烈の士
a heroic man

content:
きれっぱし〔切れっ端〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: きれはし〔切れ端〕

きれて〔切れ手〕
〈名〉
1. (=気前の好い人)a generous man; an open-handed man
2. (=敏腕家)an able man
3. (=果断家)a decisive character

content:
きれぬ〔切れぬ〕
〈接尾動詞〉Can not; more than one can; to be too much

content.content: こんなに食いきれない
I can not eat so much―This is too much for me to eat.
この荷物は一人では背負いきれない
One man can not bear this load―The load is too much for one man to bear.
彼は世帯が張りきれなくなったのだ
He can not keep house any longer.
この箱に皆入りきれぬ
The box can not hold all.
ご馳走は食いきれない
We can not eat all the good things―We have more good things than we can eat.
この本は今学期中に読みきれぬ
We cat not finish this book this term.
読みきれないほど本がある
I have more books than I can read.
あの人は使いきれないほど金がある
He has more money than he can spend.
鶏が食いきれないほど卵を産む
The hens lay more eggs than we can consume.
彼の処置はいくら責めても責めきれない

きれはし〔切れ端〕
〈名〉Scraps; odds and ends

content:
きれま〔切れ間〕
〈名〉A break; an interruption

content.content: 雨の切れ間

content:
きれめ〔切れ目〕
〈名〉
1. (=途切れ目)a break; an interruption; a gap; an interval; a rift

content.content: 雲の切れ目

話しの切れ目
a break in the conversation
切れ目をつなぐ
to stop a gap

content: 2. (=終るところ)a place to leave off; an end

content.content: ここらがちょうど切れ目が好い
This is a good place to leave off.
金の切れ目が縁の切れ目
The end of money is the end of love―“When poverty comes in at the door, love flies out at the window.”

content:
きれもの〔切れ物〕
〈名〉
1. (=刃物)an edged tool; an edge-tool:(総称すれば)cutlery

content.content: 気違いに切れ物
Do not place an edge-tool in the hands of a madman.

content: 2. (=敏腕家)an able man

きれる〔切れる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=刀などが切れる)to cut; to be sharp; to be trenchant

content.content: この小刀はよく切れる
This knife cuts well.
この小刀ちっとも切れない
The knife does not cut at all.
この剃刀はよく切れる
This razor shaves well.
切れる小刀
a sharp knife
切れる刀
a trenchant blade
手の切れそうな札
a crisp bank-note

content: 2. (=縄などが切れる)to break; to part; to snap

content.content: この縄は切れる
The rope will break.
あまり引張ると縄が切れるぞ
If you pull too hard, you will break the rope.
縄が切れた
The rope is broken.
糸がプッツリ切れる
A string snaps.
玉の緒が切れた
The life-strings are broken.
頼みの綱が切れた
My only hope is gone―My last resort has failed.
電線が切れた
The electric wire has parted―snapped.
雲が切れてきた
The clouds are breaking.

content: 3. (=電話が切れる)to be disconnected; to be cut off

content.content: 電話が切れる
The telephone is disconnected.
電話が切れた
The telephone is cut off.
電話が話し中に切れた
The telephone was cut off while we were talking.

content: 4. (=土手が切れる)to collapse; to give way

content.content: 土手が切れた
The bank gave way―The embankment collapsed.
大水で土手が切れた
The flood burst the embankment.

content: 5. (=着物などが切れる)to wear; to wear out

content.content: 着物が切れた
My clothes are worn out―the worse for wear.
切れた着物
worn-out clothes
ズボンの居敷が早く切れる
The seat of the trousers is the first to wear.
(靴下の)かかとが早く切れる
The heels are the first to wear through.
かかとが切れた
The heels are worn through.
靴が切れたから新調しなけりゃならぬ
My shoes are worn out, and I mast have a new pair made.
この上衣はだいぶ切れている
The cost has seen much service.

content: 6. (=縁が切れる)to break with (one); to cut connections with (one); to sever connections with (one)

content.content: 女が男と切れたがっている
She wishes to break with him.
女の方から切れてくれと頼んだ
She entreated him to cut connections with her.
男の方では切れたくないのだ
He does not like to break with her―He still loves her.
切れてしまえば赤の他人だ
We are nothing to each other.
二人は切っても切れない仲だ
They are bound up in each other―inseparable.
切っても切れない悪縁
It is a fatal connections―a fatal attachment.

content: 7. (=尽きる)to be exhausted; to run out:(商品なら)to get out stock:(流れなら)to fail; to be out:(期限なら)to terminate; to expire; to run out; to be up

content.content: 干ばつで水が切れた
The water-supply failed owing to the drought.
四時水の切れない流れ
a never-failing stream
油が切れた
The oil is out.
あいにくその品が切れております
The article is out of stock―We are out of the article―We have run out of the article.
もう三日で期限が切れる
The terms will expire―run out―be up―in three days.
申込みの期日はいつ切れますか
When does the time for application expire?
早く申込まないと日が切れる
If you do not apply in haste,the time will run out.
申込の期日がもう切れました
The time for application is up.
昨日切れました
It expired yesterday.
息が切れる
to get out of breath
息が切れた
I am out of breath.
息が切れて困る
I am short of breath―short-winded.
息が切れて坂が上れない
I am so short of breath that I can not ascend a slope.
それでは元値が切れます
That would be below the cost-price.

content:
9. (=幅が利く)to have influence
10. (=気前が好い)to be free with one's possessions; to be generous with one's possessions
〈形〉
1. (=敏腕な) able (man)

content.content: あの男はなかなか切れる
He is quite an able man.

content: 2. (=果断ある)decisive (man)

きろ〔帰路〕
〈名〉One's way home

content.content: 帰路米国を通過す
I passed through America on my way home.

to start on one's return―start on one's way home―start for home―turn one's steps homeward

content:
ギロギロ
〈副〉

content.content: 目がギロギロする
One's eyes goggle.
目をギロギロさせる
to goggle one's eyes

content:
きろく〔記録〕
〈名〉
1. (書き記すこと)recording:(物)a record:(=する) to record

content.content: 記録に載せる
to put anything on record
記録に残す
to leave anything on record
記録に残る
to be left on record―to remain on record
記録にある
It is on record.
新記録を作る
to make a new record
記録を破る
to break the record

content: 2. (=官文書)archives

content.content: 記録局
the Bureau of Archives

the section of archives

content:
ぎろん〔議論〕
〈名〉
1. (抽象名詞に用いれば) argument; discussion; disputation; controversy; wordy warfare:(普通名詞に用いれば)an argument; a discussion; a dispute:(世の物議となる議論)a controversy:(=する) to argue, dispute (with one about something); to cross swords with, measure swords with, break a lance with, join issue with (one's opponent)

content.content: 彼と一日議論をしても誤りを悟らせかねた
I argued with him all day, but I could not convince him of his error.
議論に及ぼう
I will join issue with you (on that point).
議論を戦わす
to argue it out―cross swords with one―break a lance with one―have a passage at arms with one―engage in wordy warfare
議論を立てる
to advance an argument―(法廷でなら)―make out one's case
立派に議論を立てた
You have made out a good case.
議論が立つ
The argument is sound―The argument is tenable―The argument holds water―The case is well made out.
議論が立たぬ
The argument is unsound―The argument is untenable―The argument does not hold water―The argument has no leg to stand on.
筋の立った議論
a logical argument―a consequent argument
その議論は筋道が立たぬ
The argument is illogical―The argument is inconsequent.
力ある議論
a cogent argument―a forcible argument
感服する議論
a convincing argument
その議論には感服せぬ
Your argument is not convincing.
そんな議論は下層社会に力がある
Such arguments have force with the masses.
彼の議論は五分の隙も無い
He is armed at all points.
卓上の議論
an academic discussion
賛成論やら反対論やら種々の議論があった
There were many pros and cons.
議論の立場を換える
to change front―shift one's ground
議論に勝つ
to confute one in argument―worst one in argument―have the best of it
議論に負ける
to be confuted in argument―be worsted in argument―have the worst of it
議論紛粉
It is a vexed question.
議論百出
It is a clamorous meeting―a stormy assembly.
その問題については議論百出であった
It was a vexed question.
議論が盛んに起こる
There is a clamour of arguments.
議論に花が咲いた
The controversy created a sensation.
議論は尽きぬ
Arguments are endless.
この問題はもう議論の余地がない
The question admits of no further discussion.

content: 2. (=意見)an opinion

content.content: これが多数の議論だ
This is the opinion of the majority.
委員は議論が分かれている
The committee is divided in opinion.
この問題については議論が分かれている
Opinion is divided on this question.

ぎろんか〔議論家〕
〈名〉An argumentative person; a disputatious person; a disputant; a controversialist; a polemic

content:
ぎろんがましい〔議論がましい〕
〈形〉Argumentative

content.content: こういうと議論がましいから止そう
I will not say things which look argumentative.

content:

〈名〉The edge (of a precipice); the brink (of ruin); the verge (of insanity)

content.content: 水ぎわ
the water's edge
彼は破滅のきわだ

in the hour of death―in the article of death
しまいぎわに
towards the close

往生ぎわの悪い奴だ

I have my doubts.

to clear one's doubts―resolve one's doubts―dispel one's doubts

〈名〉A kind of cork-tree

〈自動〉To stand out (in relief); to be conspicuous; to contrast with (the others); to be relieved against (the background)

content.content: 彼女の器量が際立って見える
Her beauty stands out conspicuously.
周囲が周囲だけに新築が際立つ
The new building contrasts finely with its surroundings.

His pen shows the character of the hero in high relief.

content:

content.content: 際立った輪郭

雪を戴いた山は碧空を背景に際立った輪郭を表している

〈名〉A kind of tunny

〈固名〉(=支那の義和団)The Boxers

content:
きわどい〔際疾い〕
〈形〉Dangerous (game); perilous (undertaking); risky (enterprise); hazardous (speculation); critical (moment); delicate (question); ticklish (matter); racy (story); spicy (story); narrow (escape); near (race); close (contest); touch-and-go (arrangement)

content.content: きわどい芸当をやりおるな
You are playing a dangerous game.
きわどい山だ
It is a risky speculation―a hazardous enterprise.
君はきわどい質問をするね
You ask a delicate question―a ticklish question.
あの先生はきわどい話をする
He tells us spicy stories―racy stories.
きわどい仕掛けだ
It is a touch-and-go arrangement.
きわどい競走だった
It was a near race―a neck-and-neck race.
きわどい競走に勝った
I won a close contest.
(法律、道徳に触れそうな)きわどいことをする
to sail near the wind―sail close to the wind
君はずいぶんきわどいことをする
You sail pretty close to the wind.
きわどいところだった(危ないところを免れた)
I had a narrow escape―It was a close shave.
きわどい時に援兵が来た
The reinforcements arrived at the critical moment―in the nick of time.
きわどいところで間に合った
I was just in time.
君はきわどいところでのろける
You fly off at a tangent to your favourite topic―seize every occasion to drag in your favourite stories.

content:
きわまりなき〔窮り無き〕
〈形〉Endless; boundless; unbounded; infinite; eternal

content.content: 遺憾窮まり無し
There is no end to my regret―It is a matter for infinite regret.
感謝窮まり無し
My gratitude is unbounded―My gratitude is beyond my power of expression.

May Thy reign be coeval with heaven and earth!

content:
きわまる〔極まる〕
〈自動〉To reach the extreme; to be carried to extremity

content.content: 愚もここに至って極まる
This is the extreme of folly―the height of folly.
無謀極まる
This is the extreme of rashness―the height of rashness.
これは無責任極まる
This is the height of negligence.
進退きわまった
I am in a fix―in a tight place―in a cleft stick―in a dilemma―on the horns of a dilemma―between the devil and the deep sea.
感極まって泣く
to be moved to tears
彼は感極まって人を殺した
He was provoked into killing a man.
歓楽極まって悲哀多し
The height of joy is a sadness.
陰極まって陽生ず
“The darkest hour is nearest the dawn.”
物極まれば必ず変ず
“When things are at their worst, they will mend.”
米価の奔騰極まるところを知らず
Rice soars in price.

content: 〈副〉Extremely; in the extreme; most; very

content.content: 失敬極まる奴だ
He is a most impertinent fellow―impertinence itself.
失敬極まる
Impertinence!
乱暴極まる奴だ
He is violence itself―violence personified―the personification of violence.
役人は無責任極まる
The officials are very irresponsible―irresponsibility itself.
不取締り極まる
There is no law or order.
貴様は不都合極まる奴だ―不埒極まる奴だ

きわみ〔極み〕
〈名〉The extreme (of cruelty); the extremity (of grief); the height (of folly); the summit (of prosperity, etc.)

〈他動〉→『

to give an opinion (on a work of art)―certify the genuineness of an article
この品は鑑定家に極めをつけて貰えば高く売れる
If the article has a certificate of genuineness by a connoisseur, it will sell at a good price.
極めつきの品
an article with a certificate of genuineness

きわめがき〔極め書き〕

極めて剛直だ

極めて明白な事実だ

彼女は黒人{くろうと}につかず素人につかず極めて曖昧なものだ
She is neither fish nor flesh.

〈他動〉
1. (=極点に達せしむ)to carry (anything) to extremity

to roll in luxury―be lapped in luxury―repose in the lap of luxury―dine off plate and repose on a bed of down―live on the fat of the land―live in clover
栄耀栄華を極める

Solomon の栄耀栄華を極めし時だもその装いこの百合に及ばざりき

暴風雨猛威を極めて襲来す

暴虐を極める

乱暴狼籍を極める

円転滑脱の妙を極める

繁劇を極める

貧窮を極める

原理を極める
to inquire into the fundamental truths

English is easy to learn, but difficult to master.

content.content: 彼女は気を利かして返事をせずに黙っておった

(=禁止する)to forbid (something―one to do something); to prohibit(something―one from doing something); to inhibit (something―one from doing something); to interdict (something―one from doing something); to ban (wine or tobacco); to place a ban on (anything), place (anything) under a ban; to lay an embargo on (anything), lay (anything) under an embargo; to taboo (anything)

content.content: 医者にタバコを禁じられた
My doctor has forbidden me to smoke.
法律は未丁年者の喫煙を禁ずる
Minors are prohibited from smoking.
喫煙を禁ず

校内喫煙を禁ず

執務中喫煙を禁ず

市内電車内ではその筋の命により喫煙が禁じてある

喫煙を禁ずる規則がある
There is a regulation against smoking.
発言を禁ずる
to forbid one to speak
ばくちは法律で禁じてある
The law prohibits gambling―prohibits people from gambling―Gambling is under the ban.
四月から九月まで銃猟は禁じてある

彼に出入りを禁じた
I have forbidden him the house.
議事は傍聴を禁じた

裁判は傍聴を禁じた

通行を禁ず

船の入港出港を禁ずる

この品は輸出入が禁じてある

content: 2. (=抑制する)to suppress (a laugh); to repress (one's anger); to stifle (a yawn); to resist (a desire); to refrain from (tears); to forbear (doing something)

くいあらため〔悔い改め〕
〈名〉Repentance; penitence; contrition:(=る) to repent (of one's sins)

content.content: 罪を悔い改めた人
a repentant sinner
罪を悔い改めた女
a fair penitent
罪を悔い改めた心
a contrite heart

content:
くいあわせ〔食い合せ〕
〈名〉
1. (=食物の食い合わせ)eating two things together (which is supposed to have a poisonous effect):(=る) to eat (two things) together

content.content: 海老と南瓜は食い合わせが悪いと言う
They say that shrimps and pumpkins have a poisonous effect when eaten together.

content: 2. (=細工の食い合わせ)dovetail:(=る) to dovetail (boards); to fit (two parts) into each other

content.content: 歯車を食い合わせる
to interlook toothed wheels―engage one toothed wheel with another

content:
くいいじ〔食い意地〕
〈名〉Gluttony

content.content: 彼は食い意地が張っている
He is gluttonous―a glutton―a greedy fellow.

content:
くいかけ〔食い掛け〕
〈形、名〉(Anything) half-eaten:(=る) to leave (anything) half-eaten

content.content: 菓子の食いかけ
a half-eaten cake
人の食いかけたパン
a piece of bread left half-eaten by another

content:
くいき〔区域〕
〈名〉
1. (=境界)the boundary; the limits

content.content: 区域を定める
to fix the boundary―fix the limits
区域内
within the limits―within the boundary
占領区域
the limits of occupied territory

content: 2. (=範囲)a sphere; a section; an area

content.content: 銘々受持区域がある
Each has his own section under his charge―his own beat―his own territory.
京都は僕の受持区域だ
Kyoto is within my beat―within my territory.
小笠原島は東京府の管轄区域に属する
The Bonin Islands are under the jurisdiction of Tokyo prefecture.
選挙区域
a constituency
伝染区域
an infected area

content:
くいきる〔食い切る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=噛み切る)to bite off (a piece); to gnaw through (a rope)
2. (=食い尽す)to eat up (all)

content.content: 鶏が食い切れないほど卵を生む
The hens lay more eggs than we can eat.

content:
グイグイ
〈副〉With jerks

content.content: 手綱をグイグイ引張る
to pull the reins with jerks―jerk the reins
グイグイ押す
to push with jerks
グイグイ飲む
to swig―swill

content:
くいくら〔食いくら〕
〈名〉An eating-match:(=する) to have an eating-match

content.content: 卵の食いくらをしよう
Let us see who can eat most eggs.

content:
くいけ〔食い気〕
〈名〉Appetite

content.content: 色気より食い気
Pudding rather than love-making.

content:
くいこみ〔食い込み〕
〈名〉A drain on the capital; a loss; a deficit

content.content: こう不景気では食い込みになる
With the times so bad, there will be a drain on the capital.
印刷工場はすっかり食い込みだ
The printing office has proved a dead loss.
一年に三千円の食い込みだ
It is a loss of 3,000 yen a year.
おおかた今月は食い込みだろう
I am afraid there will be a deficit this month.
不景気で八月は食い込みでした
Owing to slackness of trade, August was a bad month.

content:
くいこむ〔食い込む〕
〈他動〉
1. (=腐蝕する)to eat into (a metal); to eat away; to eat out; to eat up

content.content: 錆が鉄に食い込む
Rust eats into iron.
刀に錆が食い込んでいる
The sword is eaten up with rust.
河が土手に食い込む
The river eats away its bank―caves its bank.
蔓が木に食い込む
The ivy eats out the tree.

content: 2. (=侵入する)to encroach upon (a territory)

content.content: 王は隣の領分に食い込んだ
The King encroached on his neighbour's territory.
人の領分へ食い込んでは困る
You must not encroach upon my province.

content: 3. (=資本に食い込む、欠損を生じる)to drain the capital; to leave a deficit; to make a loss

content.content: 損をして資本を食い込んだ
The losses are draining the capital.
先月は不景気で食い込んだ
Owing to slackness of trade, there was a deficit last month.
おおかた今月も食い込むだろう
I am afraid there will be another deficit this month.
印刷工場は一年に三千円食い込む
The printing-office is a loss of 3,000 yen a year.

content: 4. (=賭博などが召捕られる)(A gambler) is sent up, is sent to quod

くいごろ〔食い頃〕
〈形〉(To be) in season, at its best

content.content: 雉子は今食い頃だ
Pheasants are now in season.

content:
くいさし〔食いさし〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: くいかけ〔食い掛け〕

content:
くいしばる〔喰い締る〕
〈他動〉To set, clench (one's teeth)

content.content: 歯を喰いしばる
to set one's teeth―clench one's teeth
無念そうに歯を喰いしばって死んでいた
He was found dead with his teeth set, as if in vexation of spirit.
歯を喰いしばって我慢した
I bore the pain with set teeth.

content:
くいしんぼう〔食いしんぼう〕
〈名〉A glutton; a gourmand:(=な) gluttonous; greedy

content.content: この子は食いしんぼうだね
How greedy the child is!

content:
くいすぎ〔食い過ぎ〕
〈名〉Excessive eating; surfeit:(=する) to eat too much; to overeat oneself; to surfeit oneself (with sweets, etc.)

content.content: 彼は食い過ぎしては身体をこわす
He makes himself ill by overeating himself――He eats himself ill―Surfeit Is the cause of his illness.

content:
くいたおす〔食い倒す〕
〈他動〉To sponge upon (one); to impose upon one's hospitality

content.content: 友人を食い倒してばかりはおられぬ
I can't always be sponging upon my friends―imposing upon the hospitality of my friends.

content:
くいだおれ〔食い倒れ〕
〈名〉Ruining oneself by extravagance in food

content.content: 京都の着倒れ東京の食い倒れ
The Kyoto people ruin themselves by extravagance in dress, the Tokyo people by extravagance in food.

content:
くいたらぬ〔食い足らぬ〕
〈自動〉
1. Not to have eaten enough; to have an appetite for more

content.content: まだ食い足らぬ
I have not eaten enough―I am not yet satisfied.

content: 2. (=満足せぬ)to be unsatisfied

content.content: 今の仕事では食い足らぬ
I am not satisfied with my present work―My present work leaves my hands idle.

content: 3. (=相手にするに足らぬ)to be no match for (one)

content.content: あの相手じゃちと食い足りない
He is no match for me―not a patch upon me.

くいちがい〔食い違い〕
〈名〉A mishap; a mischance; a misadventure; a contretemps

content:
くいちがう〔食い違う〕
〈自動〉
1. (=交錯する)to cross each other

content.content: 交喙{いすか}の嘴{はし}は喰い違っている
The mandibles of the crossbill's bill cross each other.

content: 2. (=齟齬する)to go wrong

content.content: する事なす事イスカのはしと喰い違い
Everything I did, went wrong with me.
先生と生徒と目的が喰い違っている
Teacher and student are at cross purposes.

くいちぎる〔喰いちぎる〕
〈他動〉To bite off (a piece)

content:
くいちらす〔食い散らす〕
〈他動〉To eat a little of (everything)

content.content: 彼は食い散らすような読み方をする
He is a desultory reader.

content:
くいつく〔食い付く〕
〈他動〉
1. (=噛み付く)to bite (one in the leg); to fasten one's teeth on (anything)

content.content: 犬に食いつかれる
to be bitten by a dog
彼は知らない犬をからかって食いつかれた
He teased a strange dog, and got bitten.
犬が僕の足に食いついた
The dog bit me in the leg.
足に食いつこうとした
The dog snapped at my leg.
あの犬は食いつきそうだ
That dog looks like biting―looks snappish.
あの犬に食いつかれないようになさいよ
See that the dog does not bite you!―Do not let the dog bite you!
あの犬は喉笛に食いつく
He will fasten his teeth upon your throat.
あの犬は吠えるだけで食いつかぬ
That dog barks at people only, he never bites.
食いつく犬は吠えつかぬ
“Beware of a silent dog.”

content: 2. (=執着する)to fix oneself on, fasten oneself on (anything)

content.content: 彼は食いついたら離れぬ
He will hold fast whatever he fastens his teeth on―grip like a bull-dog.
彼はこの問題に食いついてとうとう解決をつけた
He fixed himself upon the problem,―fastened himself upon the problem,―till at last he solved it.

content:
くいつくす〔食い尽くす〕
〈他動〉To eat up (all)

content.content: あの国では往々バッタが群を成して飛んで来て青い物を食い尽くしてしまう
The country is often invaded by flights of locusts, which eat up everything green.
船では食料を食い尽くして寄港した
The ship ran out of provisions, and put in at a port for a fresh supply.
彼はご馳走を食い尽くしてもっとくれと言った
He licked the dish clean, and held it out for more.

くいつぶし〔食い潰し〕
〈名〉An idler; a drone

content:
くいつぶす〔食い潰す〕
〈他動〉
1. To sponge upon (one); to impose upon one's hospitality; to eat (one) up; to eat (one) out of house and home

content.content: 友人を食いつぶしてばかりはおられぬ
I can't always be sponging upon my friends―imposing upon the hospitality of my friends.
彼らに食いつぶされてしまう
They will eat me up―eat me out of house and home.
彼は私立学校を食いつぶしている
He lives upon private schools.
見代を食いつぶす
to spend one's fortune in idleness
苦虫を食い潰したような顔をしている
He has a sour face.

content:
くいつめもの〔食詰者〕
〈名〉A man who has lost credit with everybody; a ruined man whom nobody will trust

content.content: あれは食詰者だ
He has lost credit with everybody―Nobody will trust him.

content:
くいつめる〔食い詰める〕
〈他動〉To eat up (a place); to lose credit with everybody; to come to the end of one's tether

content.content: 彼は東京を食い詰めて大阪へ流れ込んだ
He ate up Tokyo, and drifted to Osaka.
そんなことをしているといまに食い詰めるぞ
If you go on at that rate, you will come to the end of your tether.
ここで食い詰めたなら余所へ行く
When I have lost credit here, I will go elsewhere.

くいて〔食い手〕
〈名〉A hearty eater; a gourmand; a cormorant

content:
ぐいと〔グイと〕
〈副〉With a jerk

content.content: グイと引張る
to pull with a jerk―jerk
グイと押す
to push with a jerk―jerk
グイき飲み干す
to toss off a glass of brandy

content:
ぐいと〔グイと〕
〈副〉With a jerk

content.content: グイと引張る
to pull with a jerk―jerk
グイと押す
to push with a jerk―jerk
グイき飲み干す
to toss off a glass of brandy

くいどうらく〔食い道楽〕
〈名〉(事)epicurism; gormandize:(人) an epicure; a gourmand; a belly-god

content:
くいとめる〔喰い止める〕
〈他動〉To check (the enemy); to hold (the enemy) in check; to keep (an epidemic) at bay; to stem (a tide); to stay (an inroad)

content.content: 敵を食い止める
to check the enemy―hold the enemy in check―keep the enemy in check
殿軍が敵を喰い止めている間に本軍が退却した
The army effected its retreat while the rear-guard held the enemy in check.
ペストを喰い止めて東京へは入れずにおわった
Tokyo has kept the pest at bay―stayed the inroad of the pest.
米国では日本移民を喰い止めた
America has stemmed the tide of Japanese immigration.

content:
くいにげ〔食い逃げ〕
〈名〉Bilking an eating-house:(=する) to bilk an eating-house; to run away without paying for what one has eaten

content.content: 下宿屋の食い逃げ
to leave a boarding-house without paying the bill

くいのこし〔食い残し〕
〈名〉Remnants of food; leavings of the table; broken meat

くいのこす〔食い残す〕
〈他動〉To leave (anything) half-eaten

ぐいのみする〔グイ飲みする〕
〈自動〉To swig; to swill

content:
くいはぐれ〔食いはぐれ〕
〈名〉Loss of means of livelihood:(=る) to lose one's means of livelihood

content.content: 彼は職に離れて食いはぐれている
He is out of employment and without means of livelihood.
相撲になると食いはぐれが無い
A wrestler is sure of his salt.
実力の有る者は食いはぐれが無い
Real ability is sure of a market.

content:
くいぶち〔食い扶持〕
〈名〉(One's) keep; maintenance, support

content.content: 食い扶持を入れる
to pay for one's keep
弟子は銘々食い扶持を持って来る
Each apprentice brings his own keep with him.

content:
くいぶん〔食い分〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: くいぶち〔食い扶持〕

content:
くいもの〔食い物〕
〈名〉
1. (=食料)food; eatables; edibles; victuals; provisions

content.content: 彼は食い物を吟味する
He is choice of his food―particular about his food.
海には食い物がたくさんある
There is an abundance of food in the sea.
船に食い物が無くなった
The ship ran out of provisions―ran short of provisions.
牛は食い物が好いから太っている
The cows are well fed and fat.
豚は食い物が悪いから痩せている
The pigs are ill fed and lean.
食い物と飲み物
food and drink―eatables and drinkables

content: 2. (=餌食)a prey; a victim

content.content: 詐欺師の食い物になった
I fell a prey to a swindler―fell a victim to fraud.
ポン引きは田舎者を食い物にする
Sharpers prey upon country-people.
娘を食い物にする者がある
Some people live on their daughters.

content:
くいる〔悔いる〕
〈他動〉To repent of (one's sins); to regret (what has happened); to rue (the day, the hour when anything happened); to be sorry for (what one has done); to be penitent for (one's sin); to be contrite

content.content: 彼は悪いことをしたのを悔いている
He is sorry for what he has done―He repents of having done wrong―He regrets what has happened.
僕は若い時勉強しなかったのを悔いている
I am sorry I was idle in my youth―I repent of my past idleness.
半途に退学したのを悔いている
I am sorry I left school half-way―I repent of having left school half-way―I rue the day when I left school half-way.
前非を悔いる
to repent of one's past
罪を悔いる
to repent of one's sins
彼女は罪を犯したのを悔いている
She repents of her sin―She is repentant of her sin―penitent for her sin―a penitent sinner―a repentant sinner.
罪を犯しても悔いれば天之を赦し給う
Heaven will pardon a contrite heart.
悔いても帰らぬ
Regrets will not mend matters.
悔いても帰らぬ事をくよくよするな
Do not indulge in vain regrets―“It is no use crying over spilt milk.”

content:
くう〔空〕
〈名〉
1. (=空間)space
2. (=空隙、隙明き)a space
3. (=空虚)vacuity; vanity

content.content: 一切是空
All is vanity.

content: 4. (=空中)the air; the sky

content.content: 彼は空をつかんで苦しんだ
He clutched at the air in his agony.
空に消えた
It dissolved into the air―melted into the air.
馬が空を蹴る
A horse kicks out―lashes out.

content: 5. (=無駄)nothing; naught

content.content: せっかくの骨折りは空に帰した
All my efforts have come to naught.

content: 6. (=無心)abstraction; absent-mindedness; idleness:(=に) abstractedly; absent-mindedly; idly

content.content: 人の話を空に聴いている
He listens abstractedly to you―listens absent-mindedly to you.
時を空に過す
to pass one's time in idleness―idle one's time away

content:
〈形〉
1. (=から)empty; vacant; hollow

content.content: 空談
empty talk

content: 2. (=事実無き、根拠無き)idle

content.content: 空な話だ
It is an idle talk.
そんな空な話に耳を貸すものでない
You should not listen to such idle tales.

content:
くう〔食う〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=くらう)to eat; to take(one's meals); to make (one's meal):(消費するの意味なら)to consume:(こっけいに言えば)to feed

content.content: 人は食う為に生きるか生きる為に食うか
Does man live to eat or eat to live?
何か食う物があるか
Have you anything to eat?
食うものはなにも無い
There is nothing to eat in the house.
何か食うものをこしらえて上げよう
I will get you something to eat.
飯を食う
to take one's meals―make one's meal―(どうして暮らすの意味なら)―get one's living―gain one's livelihood
この子はよく飯を食う
The boy has a good appetite.
運動すると飯が食える
Exercise gives one a good appetite.
飯を食ったか、朝飯を食ったか
Have you taken your meal?―had your breakfast?
行って見ると家族は朝飯を食っていた
I found the family at breakfast.
僕は朝飯に卵を食う
I eat eggs at breakfast―breakfast on eggs.
彼は朝飯も食わずに出て行った
He went out without waiting to eat his breakfast.
昼飯に何を食ったか
What did you have for dinner?
彼は飯を食いに家へ帰ったのだ
He has gone home for his dinner.
飯を食って行き給え
You must stay dinner.
飯を食わずにいる
to go without one's meals
彼は夕飯を食わないことが往々あった
He had often to go without his supper.
夕飯を食わずに寝る
to go supperless to bed
同じ釜の飯を食った仲だ
We have lived under the same roof―eaten off the same trencher.
我々は米を食って生きている
We live on rice.
食わずに生きていられぬ
One can not live on nothing―live on air.
日本人は箸で食う
The Japanese eat with chopsticks.
西洋人はナイフとフォークで食う
Foreigners eat with knife and fork.
彼はよく食う
He plays a good knife and fork―He is a good trencherman―He is a good eater.
生で食う
to eat anything raw
煮て食う
to eat anything boiled
焼いて食う
to eat anything broiled
煮ても焼いても食えない奴
He is too old a bird to be caught with chaff.
僕は猫の性で熱いものが食えない
Like a cat, I can not eat anything hot.
腹いっぱい食う
to eat one's fill―line one's stomach―line one's jacket
控え目に食う
to be temperate in eating
さもうまそうに食う
to eat with relish―relish one's food
掻込んで食う
to shovel food into one's mouth―bolt one's dinner
いやになるほど食う
to surfeit oneself (with sweets, etc.)
ご馳走を食う
to make good cheer
うまい物を食う
to treat oneself to titbits
金銀の皿で食う
to dine off plate
うちの鶏は食いきれないほど卵を生む
Our hens lay more eggs than we can consume.
食うものも食わぬ
to deny oneself the comforts of life―(人の為なら)―make sacrifices
食うものも食わずに金をためるほで愚かなことは無い
Nothing can be more foolish than to deny oneself the comforts of life in order to save money.
彼の両親は食うものも食わずに彼に学費を仕送った
His parents made sacrifices to support him in school.
毒を食うなら皿までも
“In for a penny, in for a pound.”
猪を食った報いだ
He must pay dearly for his follies.
武士は食わねど高楊枝
The samurai glories in honourable poverty.
夫婦げんかは犬も食わぬ
One should not interfere in lovers' quarrels.
食わず貧乏高枕
“Little gear, less care.”

content: 2. (=暮らす)to live (on one's salary―by one's trade); to subsist (on charity); to get one's living; to make a (good or poor) living; to gain one's livelihood; to earn one's bread

content.content: 君はどうして(飯を)食って居るか
How do you live?―get your living?―gain your livelihood?
青年は第一に飯を食うことを覚えなくちゃならぬ
The first thing a young man has to learn, is to get his living.
彼は独りで飯が食えるようになった
He can now get his own living.
彼は働いて食っている
He earns his livelihood―He works for his bread.
彼は働かなくとも食っていける身分だ
He is above the necessity of working for his bread.
月給で食っている
He lives on his salary.
畑の物で食っている
He lives on the produce of his farm.
商売で食っている
He lives by his trade―lives by his business.
筆で食っている
He lives by the pen.
女房に稼がせて食っている
He lives on his wife's earnings.
貰って食っている
He subsists on charity―subsists on people's bounty.
どうかこうか食っている
He manages to live―He lives by hook or by crook.
娘を食う者がある
Some people live on their daughters.
私は十年以上も海軍の飯を食っています
I have served in the navy for upwards of ten years.
少しは他人の飯を食って見るが好い
You ought to know what it is to depend on strangers.
君は食うだけ取れるか
Can you get enough to live on?
彼は食うに困っている
He has nothing to live on―He has no means of livelihood.
彼は免職になったら今日食うに困るだろう
If he loses his place, he will have nothing to live on.
この金があれば当分食うに困らぬ
This sum will keep the wolf from the door for the present.
遺族は食うに困らぬ
His family are well provided for―well left.
彼は食うや食わずだ
He wants the necessaries of life―He is distressed for necessaries.
彼はぜいたくどころか食うや食わずだ
He wants the bare necessaries of life, to say nothing of luxuries.
薄給で食うや食わずだ
He starves on scanty pay.

to make nothing of―make light of―underrate―anything
これしきのことと多寡をくくっていた
I made light of the matter.

I made light of the examination.

content: 2. (=怪しい)suspicious

content:

〈他動〉
1. To allow (anything) to rot or decay; to putrefy (flesh); to decompose (a body); to spoil, addle (eggs); to taint (meat); to corrupt (fruit); to corrode (metals)

content.content: 一つ腐ったリンゴがあると他のリンゴを腐らす
One decayed apple corrupts the others.
藁を腐らして肥やしにする
Straw is allowed to rot and used as manure.
このインキはペンを腐らす憂いが無い

気を腐らす
to lose heart―be disheartened―be discouraged―be dispirited―be dejected―be cast down―be cut up
彼は失敗して気を腐らしている
He is dejected―cast down―by his failure.
細君を無くなしてひどく気を腐らしている

この世の中は些細な困難に気を腐らしておれる世の中じゃない
This is not a world where we can afford to be discouraged by trifles―lose heart over trifles.
年を腐らす
to wear away one's life―wear out one's youth
好い若い者が何もせずに年を腐らしている
He is wearing out his youth in inaction.

to enchain two things―(犬なら)―chain up a dog―(罪人なら)―put a prisoner in chains
囚人は鎖でつながれている
The convict is in chains―in fetters―in irons.

to unlink a chain―(犬のなら)―unchain a dog―(罪人なら)―put a prisoner out of chains.

content:
くさる〔腐る〕
〈自動〉
1. To rot; to decay; to putrefy; to decompose; to corrupt; (meat) taints; (eggs) addle, spoil; (milk) turns sour; (pickles) go bad; (metals) corrode

content.content: 暑いと肉が腐る
Meat taints in hot weather.
肉が腐っている
(食用の肉なら)The meat is tainted―(身体の肉なら)―The flesh is putrid.
腐った肉
tainted meat―putrid flesh―carrion
鳥は腐った肉を食う
The crow feeds on carrion.
暑いと卵は腐る
The heat spoils the eggs.
玉子が腐っている
The eggs are addled―rotten―(食えないだけの意味なら)―spoilt.
腐った卵
spoilt eggs―addled eggs―rotten eggs
魚が腐っている
The fish is rotten―(食えないだけの意味なら)―stale.
腐った魚
rotten fish―stale fish
魚は腐りやすい
Fish is subject to speedy decay―perishable.
腐りやすい品物
perishable goods
牛乳が腐る
Milk turns sour.
この牛乳は腐りかけている
The milk is on the turn.
雷が鳴ると牛乳が腐る
Thunder turns milk sour.
そんな声を出すと糖味噌が腐る
You will turn the milk sour.
漬物が腐った
The pickles have gone bad.
土台が腐っている
The foundation is rotten.
死骸が腐っている
The body is decayed―decomposed―putrefied.
あの女は心が腐っている
Her heart is corrupt―She has a corrupt heart.
心底までも腐っている
She is rotten to the core.
腐った魂
a corrupt soul
この酒はいつまで置いても腐らない
This wine will keep long―keep good for any length of time.
落ちたリンゴは腐りやすい
Fallen apples will not keep.
この魚は明日まで置くと腐る、明日まで置いても腐らぬ
The fish will not keep overnight―will keep overnight.
傷が腐る

content.content: こんな好い天気に家の中にくすぶっている奴があるか
Who ever heard of a fellow cowering at home in such glorious weather?
彼は中学校にくすぶっている
He leads a humdrum life as middle-school teacher.
彼女は商売を止してくすぶっている
She has given up her gay profession and lives a jog-trot life.
商売を止してもくすぶってはいけない
Even if you retire from the gay life, you must not cease to be attractive.
田舎にくすぶっていてはつまらん
It wouldn't do to lie buried in the country.

content:

〈他動〉To smoke; to fumigate

content.content: 室内を硫黄で燻べる
to fumigate a room with sulphur
燻べたガラス
smoked glass

くずもの〔屑物〕

content:
くずや〔屑屋〕
