content.content: 屑屋お払い
Rags to sell?

content:
くすり〔薬〕
〈名〉
1. A medicine; a drug; a remedy; physic:(つけ薬)a lotion; an ointment; a liniment:(水薬)a liquid medicine, a draught:(粉薬)a powder:(洗い薬)a wash; a lotion:(目薬)an eye-water:(蒸し薬)fomentation

content.content: 薬の功能
the virtue of a medicine―the efficacy of a medicine
この薬は功能が有る
The medicine is efficacious.
薬が利いた
The medicine has taken effect.
薬を飲んで少しも利かない
The medicine has effect on me.
この薬は不思議に利く
The medicine works wonders.
薬を服す、薬を飲む
to take medicine
粉薬を湯で飲む
to take a powder with hot water―wash down a powder with hot water
薬を飲み違える
to take the wrong medicine (by mistake)
この薬を飲むと君の病気は治る
This medicine will cure you of your disease.
この薬を飲むと楽になります
This medicine will relieve you of your pain―give you relief.
お薬を戴いてたいそう楽になりました
Your medicine has given me much relief.
薬を盛る
to administer medicine (to a patient)―dose a patient
薬を処方する
to prescribe a medicine (to a patient)
薬を調合する
to compound a medicine―mix a medicine
この薬に何が入るか
What enter into the composition of this medicine?
この薬には阿片が入る
Opium enters into the composition of this medicine.
薬を施す
to dispense medicine
キニーネは何の薬になるか
What is quinine good for?
熱の薬になる
It is good for fevers.
苦い物は胃の薬
Bitters are good for the stomach.
蜂蜜は咳の薬
Honey is good for the cough―Honey helps the cough.
小豆は脚気の薬(特効薬)
Red beans are a remedy for beriberi―a specific for beriberi.
油は火傷の薬(妙薬)
Oils are a sovereign remedy for burns.
風邪の薬は無いものか
Is there no remedy for colds?
万病の薬
a panacea for all complaints―a heal-all
不老不治の薬
the elixir of life
ばかにつける薬無し
No medicine can cure folly.
薬より養生
“Prevention is better than cure”―“An ounce of prevention is better than a pound of cure.”
一に看病二に薬
Nursing first and medicine next.
医者や薬の奉公をする
to lay out one's earnings in the doctor's bill
薬一服
a dose of medicine
屁一つは薬千服に当たる
A single discharge of wind is equivalent to a thousand doses of medicine.
薬九層倍
Medicine sells for nine times its value.
そんなものは薬にしたくも無い
That is not a spice of it―not a suspicion of it.
あの人はこっけいなどは薬にしたくも無い
There is not a spice of humour―not a suspicion of humour―in him.

content: 2. (=化学的薬品)chemicals

content.content: 薬を製造する
to manufacture chemicals

content: 3. (=火薬)gunpowder

content.content: 薬と弾
powder and shot

content: 4. (=釉薬)enamel; glaze

content.content: 瀬戸物に薬をかける
to glaze pottery―enamel pottery

content: 5. (=裨益)benefit; good

content.content: 運動は身体の薬だ
Exercise is good for the health―beneficial to health―Exercise will do you good.
汗を出すのは身体の薬だ
Perspiration will do you good.
酒は適度に飲めば薬だ
Wine, taken in moderation, is good for the health.
朝起きは心身の薬だ
Early rising is good for mind and body.
そんな物は毒にも薬にもならぬ
It will do neither good nor harm.
そんなことをしても毒にもならぬ
That will not mend or mar matters.
あんな人間は毒にも薬にもならぬ
We have nothing to hope or fear from such men.
苦労するのは薬だ
“Sweet are the uses of adversity.”
甲の薬は乙の毒
“One man's meat is another man's poison.”
目の薬だ
It is a sight for sore eyes.

くすりだい〔薬代〕
〈名〉A charge for medicine; the doctor's bill

くすりばこ〔薬箱〕
〈名〉A medicine-chest

くすりびん〔薬瓶〕
〈名〉A phial; a vial

content:
くすりや〔薬屋〕
〈名〉An apothecary; a pharmacy; a drug-store:(英国にては)a chemist:(米国にて)a druggist

content.content: それはどこの薬屋にもある
It is to be had at any chemist's―at any druggist's.

くすりゆ〔薬湯〕
〈名〉A medicated bath

くすりゆび〔薬指〕
〈名〉The fourth finger:(左の手のは)the ring-finger

content:
くずれる〔崩れる〕
〈自動〉
1. To crumble; to fall to pieces; to drop to pieces:(石垣や土手なら)to give way; to collapse; to be destroyed; to come down:(軍隊なら)to give way; to be thrown into disorder; to be thrown into confusion; to be routed:(はれものなら)to ulcerate:(物の型なら)to get out of shape

content.content: 岩が空気の作用でボロボロ崩れる
Rock crumbles to dust by the action of air.
崖が崩れて下の家がつぶれた
A cliff crumbled down―came down―and crushed the houses below.
荷造りが悪いと荷物が途中で崩れる恐れがある
If the goods are not well packed, there is danger of their falling to pieces―dropping to pieces―on the way.
地震で石垣が崩れた
The earthquake destroyed the stone-wall.
洪水で土手が崩れた
The bank gave way―The embankment collapsed―in the flood.
千丈の提も蟻の穴より崩れる
An ant-hole will destroy a dyke―(に相当するは)―“A little leak will sink a great ship.”
隊が崩れる
The ranks give way.
敵は総崩れに崩れた
The enemy were utterly routed.
最初右翼の方が崩れた
The right wing was first thrown into confusion.
敵艦隊が崩れ出した
The enemy fleet began to be thrown into disorder.
はれものは一度崩れないと治らぬ
A tumour must ulcerate before it can heal.
型の崩れた帽子
a hat battered out of shape―a battered hat

content:
2. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 悪疾で顔が崩れている
His face is disfigured by disease.
彼は酒を飲んでも崩れない
Wine does not affect him.
その光景を見て皆笑い崩れた
The sight upset their gravity.
礼儀が崩れる
Propriety is forgotten.

content:
くすんだ
〈形〉Dark; dull; sombre

content.content: くすんだ赤
a dark red―a dull red
くすんだ茶色
a dark brown―a sombre brown

content:
くせ〔癖〕
〈名〉
1. (=習癖)a habit; a way; a trick

content.content: 寝床で読書するのは悪い癖だ
Reading in bed is a bad habit.
あの人は妙な癖がある
He has a queer way―some queer ways―about him.
同じことを二度言う癖がある
He has a trick of repeating himself.
妙な時にしゃれを言う癖がある
He has a habit of being witty out of season―He is in the habit of being witty out of season.
何でも困ると膝を撫でる癖がある
He has a way of nursing his knees when he is in perplexity.
自慢する癖がある
He has a habit of boasting―He has a way of boasting―He is in the way of boasting―He is in the habit of boasting―He is given to boasting.
彼は「そりゃーそうさ」と言う癖がある
He has a way of saying, “There is no doubt about it.”
それが君ら学生の癖だ
That is the way with you students.
この時計は十二時に一つ打つ癖がある
This clock will strike one at twelve.
悪い癖がつく
to get into a habit―fall into a habit―contract a habit―acquire a habit
善い癖を付ける
to acquire a habit―cultivate a habit
この子は嘘をつく癖がついた
The boy has fallen into a habit of lying.
僕は早起きの癖をつけた
I have cultivated the habit of early rising.
悪い癖はつきやすいが善い癖は付きにくい
Bad habits are easy to contract, but good habits are hard to acquire.
成金が女中どもに悪い癖をつけた
The upstarts have spoiled the servants.
女中どもに悪い癖がついている
The servants are spoiled.
癖になる
to become a habit―create a precedent
下剤を用いると癖になる
The use of purgative becomes a habit.
ぜいたくをしつけると癖になる
Luxury becomes a habit.
一遍要求を容れると癖になる
If you comply with their demands once, it will create a precedent.
金をやると癖になる
If you give him money, you will spoil him―Money will spoil him.
黙っていると癖になるからうんと叱っておやり
Silence will spoil him. You must give him a sound rating.
ダバコは好きではないが癖になって飲む
I do not like tobacco, but I smoke from habit.
癖を直す
to cure one of a habit―beat one out of a habit
この子は嘘を言う癖が直らないいくら殴っても直らない
I can not cure him of the habit of lying―beat him out of the habit of lying.
自分の癖を直す
to break oneself of a habit―get rid of a habit―get over a habit
僕はどうしても朝寝の癖が直らぬ
I can not break myself of the habit of late-rising.
どもる癖は直る
One can be cured of the habit of stammering.
癖は抜けない
Habits are hard to get rid of.
彼は自慢する癖が抜けない
He can not get rid of the habit of boasting.
悪い癖はつきやすく直り難い
Bad habits are easy to get into and hard to get rid of.

content: 2. (=性癖)a natural disposition; a predisposition; a trait of character; a characteristic; a peculiarity; an idiosyncracy; an inclination (for something); a propensity (to something); a proclivity (to something); a bias (towards something); a turn (for something); a twist; a mental twist

content.content: 豪傑には癖あり
A great man will have his peculiarity―his idiosyncracy.
持った癖は隠せない
One's nature will assert itself.
癖は往々遺伝する
A trait of character is often inherited.
あの人は言葉に癖がある
He has a peculiarity in speech―a peculiar manner of speaking.
針小棒大の癖がある
He has a propensity to exaggeration―a proclivity to making mountains of mole-hills.
あの少年は文学に傾く癖がある
The boy has an inclination for literature―a bias towards literature.
今一人の方は実験を好む癖がある
The other boy has a turn for experiments.
癖だらけの人間だ
He is full of mental twists.

content: 3. (=弱点、欠点)a foible; a fault

content.content: 誰でも何か得意がる癖がある
Every man has his foibles.
無くて七癖
Every man has his faults―No man is without his faults―No man is free from faults.

content: 4. (=特徴)a tone:(国語のなら)an idiom; a genius

content.content: 人の癖を取る
to hit one's tone
彼はよく沙翁{しゃおう=シェークスピア}の癖を取った
He has hit the tone of Shakespeare.
どこの国語にも癖がある
Every language has its idioms.
英語の癖を取る
to learn the English idiom―catch the genius of the English language
ひと癖ありそうな顔
a sinister face
ひと癖ありそうな人間だ
He is a sinister-looking man.
癖の有る味、癖の有る匂い
a pronounced taste―a pronounced smell

content: 6. (=文芸の癖)mannerism

content.content: あの人の文章には癖がある
There is a mannerism about his style―His style is full of mannerism―He is a mannerist.

content: 7. (=馬の癖)a vice

content.content: 名馬に癖あり
A Bucephalus will have his vices.
癖のある馬
a vicious horse

content: 8. (=髪の癖)a curl

content.content: 癖を直す
to straighten out curls―rid the hair of curls
癖毛
curly hair
彼は酒癖が悪い
He is quarrelsome in his cups―He will brawl over his cups.
手癖が悪い
He is a kleptomaniac―He is light-fingered―His fingers are lime-twigs.
その癖
and yet
彼は何でも知っているようなことを言っている、そのくせ何も知らない
He talks as if he knew everything, and yet he knows nothing.
彼は普請をするなどと言っている、そのくせ金が無い
He talks of building himself a new house, and yet he has no money.
何々の癖に
and yet―though―as if―while―when
彼は金も無いくせに普請をするなどと言っている

He has no money, and yet he talks of building himself a new house―Though he has no money, he talks of building himself a new house―He talks of building himself a new house when he has no money―He talks of building himself a new house as if he had plenty of money.
何も知らないくせに何でも知っているようなことを言っている
He knows nothing, and yet he talks as if he knew everything―He talks as if he knew everything while he knows nothing at all.
ろくに手紙も欠けないくせにあんな生意気言っている
He talks such impertinence when he can's write a letter properly.
子どものくせにタバコなんか吹かして
You are smoking tobacco when you are a child―as if you were a man!
女のくせに凧を揚げるって
You fly a kite when you are a girl―as if you were a boy!
男のくせに白粉などつけて
You paint your face when you are a man―as if you were a woman!
君は知っているくせに人に尋ねる
You ask me as if you did not know.
なんだい知っているくせに
As if you did not know!
なんだいなにも知らないくせに
As if you knew everything!
なんだい金も無いくせに
As if you were a rich man!

content:
くせつ〔苦節〕
〈名〉Grim fidelity to one's cause; fidelity to the death

content.content: 苦節を守る
to remain faithful to the death―remain faithful to one's cause through thick and thin

content:
くぜつ〔口説〕
〈名〉A lovers' quarrel

content.content: それが口説の種になる
It will give rise to a quarrel between the lovers.

content:
ぐせつ〔愚説〕
〈名〉
1. (=愚な説)a foolish opinion; absurd views

content.content: そりゃ愚説だ
Your views are absurd.

content: 2. (=自分の説を謙遜してかく言えば)my humble opinion

くせもの〔曲者〕
〈名〉(怪しからん奴)a miscreant:(悪者)a rascal; a scoundrel:(泥棒)a thief; a robber; a burglar:(怪しい奴)a suspicious fellow

content.content: 曲者御参なれ
Ha! miscreant!
曲者待てっ
Stop thief!
あれは手におえない曲者だ
He is an ugly customer to deal with―an awkward customer to deal with.
大胆不敵の曲者だ
He is an audacious scoundrel.
恋は曲者
“Love knoweth no laws.”

content:
くせん〔苦戦〕
〈名〉Hard fighting:(一回なら)a hard fight; a hard-fought field:(=する) to fight hard

content.content: 一年間の苦戦の後要塞を落とした
The fortress was reduced after a year of hard fighting.
我が軍は優勢の敵を受けて苦戦した
We had to fight against heavy odds.
戦闘の衝に当たって苦戦したのが十九連隊
The Nineteenth bore the brunt of the fight.

content:
くそ〔糞〕
〈名〉
1. Ordure; excrement; faeces:(卑語)shit:(の塊)a turd:(牛馬のは)dung:(鳥獣のは)droppings

content.content: 糞をする、糞をひる、糞をたれる
to move the bowels―evacuate the bowels―evacuate excrement―void excrement―go to stool―(卑語)―shit―(以下大小便を兼ぬ)―ease nature―relieve nature―do one's needs―obey the calls of nature
目糞
gum
耳糞
ear-wax
歯糞
the dirt on the teeth
鼻糞
the dirt in the nose
ええくそ
Damn it!―Dash it!―Hang it!―Dang it!
なにくそ俺がやって見せる
Damn me, I'll do it.
糞でも食らえ
I'll see you hanged first.
あんな奴糞を食らえ
I don's care a fig for him.
三井岩崎糞食らえ
I snap my fingers at the Mitsuis and Iwasakis.
犬の糞でかたきを取る
to throw dirt at a man
糞味噌にけなす
to decry one in most disparaging terms
糞勉強する
to grind―swot―sap
糞度胸がある
He has a dare-devil courage.
糞落書きに落ち着いている
He is cool as a cucumber.
糞真面目な人だ
He is a matter-of-fact man.
くそ力がある
He has animal strength―baresark strength.
糞たれめ
The wretch!

content:
くそおちつき〔糞落着き〕
〈名〉Cool composure

content.content: 彼は糞落着きに落着いている
He is cool as a cucumber.

content:
ぐそく〔具足〕
〈名〉A suit of armour

content.content: 具足びつ
an armour-chest
具足師
an armourer

くそぢから〔糞力〕
〈名〉Animal strength; baresark strength

content:
くそどきょう〔糞度胸〕
〈名〉Dare-devil courage

content.content: 糞度胸がある
He has a dare-devil courage.

content:
くそべんきょう〔糞勉強〕
〈名〉Grind; swot; sap:(=する) to grind; to swot; to sap

content.content: あれは糞勉強家だ
He is a grind―a swot―a sap.

content:
くそまじめ〔糞真面目〕
〈形〉Matter-of-fact

content.content: 糞真面目な人だ
He is a matter-of-fact man.

content:
くそみそ〔糞味噌〕
〈名〉Most disparaging terms

content.content: 人を糞味噌にけなす
to decry one in most disparaging terms

content:
くだ〔管〕
〈名〉
1. A pipe; a tube

content.content: 鉄の管
an iron pipe
ガラスの管
a glass tube
ゴムの管
an india-rubber tube
管を通る
to pass through a tube
管がふさがる
A pipe is choked (clogged or stopped up).

content: 2. (=糸をまく管)a reel; a spool

content.content: くだをまく
to reel
酔ってくだまく
to talk incoherently in one's cups―drink oneself into incoherence

content:
ぐたい〔具体〕
〈名〉Concreteness; embodiment:(=する) to embody (a principle in an institution)

content.content: 原理や理想が具体して社会の制度となる
Principles and ideas are embodied in social institutions.
この計画はどう具体化するか見物だ
How the scheme takes shape―materializes―will be watched with interest.
具体化する
to make concrete―(自動詞に用いれば)―take shape―materialize

content:
ぐたいてき〔具体的〕
〈形〉Concrete; corporeal; palpable; tangible:(=に) in the concrete; in a concrete form; in a palpable form; in a tangible form

content.content: 具体的に言えば月給を上げてやるがよい
To put it in the concrete,―To put it in a more concrete form,―you must raise their salary.
抽象的に言っては人にわからぬ、もっと具体的に言わないとわからぬ
People will not understand you if you speak in the abstract―you must put it in a more palpable form―you must put it in a more tangible form.

content:
くだく〔砕く〕
〈他動〉To break (to pieces); to shiver (to pieces); to smash (to fragments); to crush (to pieces); to shatter

content.content: 火薬で岩を砕く
to blow up a rock
粉微塵に砕く
to break anything to pieces―shiver anything to pieces―smash anything to fragments―(爆発してなら)―blow anything to atoms
身を粉にくだく
to fag oneself to death―drudge oneself to death
心を(千々に)くだく
to rack one's brains―beat one's brains―cudgel one's brains―tax one's ingenuity
好きには身をくだく
Love spares no pains.
国の為仇なす
Yet, white ye smite with all your might
仇は砕くとも
Your country's bitter foe,
いつくしむべき
Let not your hearts forget with love
事な忘れそ
For all mankind to glow!

content:
クタクタ
〈形〉Limp

content.content: 襟が汗でクタクタになった
My collar is limp with sweat.
クタクタに疲れた
I am reduced to pulp―ready to drop with fatigue.
クタクタに煮える
to be boiled to a pulp

content:
グタグタ
〈形〉Limp

content.content: 疲れてグタグタになった
I am completely done up―reduced to pulp―ready to drop.
煮え過ぎてグタグタになる
to be boiled to a pulp

content:
グダグダ
〈形〉→『

content.content: グタグタ

content:
くだくだしい〔管々しい〕
〈形〉Tedious; tiresome; wearisome

content.content: 彼の話しはくだくだしい
He is a tedious talker―It is wearisome to listen to him.
一々挙げるのはくだくだしいから
It would be tedious to enumerate them.
そうくだくだしく言うことは無い
You need not speak so tediously―go into such details.

content:
くだける〔砕ける〕
〈自動〉
1. To break (to pieces); to be broken (to pieces); to be smashed (to fragments); to go to pieces; to shiver to pieces; to be shattered; to crumble (to dust)

content.content: 波が岩に当たって砕ける
The waves break on the rocks.
岩に砕ける波の音
the booming of breakers
徳利が落ちて砕けた
The bottle fell to the ground and broke to pieces.
岩が砕ける
Rock crumbles (to dust).
船は暗礁に乗り上げて砕けてしまった
The ship ran on a rock and went to pieces.
波が荒くて船が砕けるかと思うほど揺れた
The sea racked the ship.
全身砕けそうに咳をした
The cough seemed to rack his whole frame.
粉微塵に砕ける
to be broken to pieces―shivered to pieces―smashed to fragments―(爆発してなら)―blown to atoms
この崖から落ちようものなら岩に当たって粉微塵に砕けてしまう
If you were to fall over this precipice, you would be dashed to pieces on the rocks below.
当たって砕けろ
I will take my chance―take the chances―chance it―take the risks―risk it.

content: 2. (=さばける)to become humanized; to become complaisant; to become familiar; to condescend

content.content: 彼は世間へ出てからたいそうくだけた
The world has humanized him.
くだけて出る
to show complaisance―condescend
先方でくだけて出たのでちと張合が抜けた
His complaisance rather disappointed me.
君がそうくだけて出れば先でも心が解けるだろう
Such condescension on your part will make him relent.
もっとくだけた言葉で言うとどうなるかね
How would you put it in more familiar language?
先生の訳はくだけている
He translates in familiar language.
くだけた訳
a popular translation
あれはくだけた人だ
He is a complaisant men―a people's man.
あの人はくだけない人だ
He is a formalist―He will stand upon points.

content:
くださらない〔下さらない〕
〈形〉(To be) unwelcome:(動詞に訳せば) to come amiss

content.content: この寒いのに旅行は下さらないね
A journey in this cold weather is not welcome―out of season.

content:
くださる〔下さる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=くれるの敬語)please give me; vouchsafe me; oblige me with; make me a present of

content.content: もったいなくもお返事を下すった
He vouchsafed me an answer.
どうぞ早くお返事を下さい
Please oblige me with an early answer.
お写真を一枚下さいませんか
Will you make me a present of your photograph?
この本を一部譲って下さいませんか
Will you spare me a copy of this book?
その本を下さい
Give me that book!
下さるものなら夏もお小袖
Nothing comes amiss to the needy.［注意］前置詞(for)をもって表す場合あり。
この本は私に下さるのですか
Is this book for me?
この箱は誰に下さるのですか
Whom is this box for?

content: 2. (=何々して下さる)to condescend, deign, vouchsafe (to do something); (will you) please, kindly, be so kind as to, be good enough to, have the goodness to (do so); you will; you would; I beg you will; I wish you would

content.content: ご自身に案内して下すった
He condescended to show me the way in person.
ありがたいことにはそう言って下すった
He deigned to say so to me.
粗品ながらご受納下さい
Vouchsafe to accept a trifling present―I beg you will accept a trifling present.
金を少々貸して下さい
Please―Kindly―Be so kind as to―Be good enough to―Have the goodness to―lend me some money.
来て下さい
Please come―Will you come?―I wish you would come.
そうして下さらばありがたい
If you will do so, I shall be obliged to you―If you would do so, I should esteem it a favour.［注意］前置詞句(for me)を以て表わす場合あり。
ここ明けて下さい
Open the door for me!
手紙を書いて下さい
Write a letter for me!
この手紙を読んで下さいな
Read this letter for me!［注意］「買って下さる」「こしらえて下さる」等には“for me”の“for”を略して“me”を間接目的とす。
靴を一足買って下さい
Buy me a pair of shoes!
洋服をこしらえて下さい
Make me a suit of clothes!
切符を買って下さい
Get me a ticket!
絵を書いて下さい
Paint me a picture!［注意］英語に訳さぬ場合あり。
来て下さるまいと思った
I did not think you would come.
はるばるお出で下すったのに不在でお気の毒です
I am sorry you find him absent after coming all this way.

content:
くだし〔下し〕
〈名〉
1. (=瀉下)Purgation; evacuation
2. (=下し薬)a purgative; a cathartic; an evacuant:(緩慢なのは) a laxative; an aperient

content.content: 下しをかける
to use a purgative―take a cathartic―purge the bowels―evacuate the bowels―open the bowels―loosen the bowels

content:
くだす〔下す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=おろす)to let down; to lower

content.content: 河に筏を下す
to float a raft down a river
糟糠の妻は堂を下さず
You should not discard in prosperity a wife married in adversity.

content: 2. (=賜う)to give; to grant; to send

content.content: 陛下には優渥なる勅語を下し給えり
His Majesty was pleased to give a gracious message.
年金五百円下し給う
The Emperor is pleased to grant you a pension of 500 yen a year.
天は我等に禍福を下し給う
Heaven sends us good and evil―visits us with blessings and curses.
腹を下す
to have an attack of diarrhoea―have loose bowels―(下剤をかけてなら)―purge the bowels―evacuate the bowels―open the bowels―loosen the bowels
僕は腹を下している
My bowels are loose―I have loosen bowels―I have an attack of diarrhoea.
腹を下して身体が衰弱した
Diarrhoea has pulled me down.
財布が腹を下している
My money is running low.
獄に下す
to cast one into prison―put one in prison―imprison one
彼は捕えられて獄に下された
He was apprehended and imprisoned―put in prison―cast into prison.
命令を下す
to give orders―issue orders
大将は進軍の命令を下した
The genera gave orders to advance.
判断を下す
to draw an inference (from facts)
判決を下す
to give decision on a case―pass judgment on a case
批評を下す
to pass a criticism on a work―pass one's opinion on anything
定義を下す
to give a definition―define a word
手を下す
to lay violent hands on a person
彼は自ら手を下してその人を殺したのだ
He killed the man with his own hands.
筆を下す
to put pen to paper
筆を下す前によく考えて
Arrange your ideas before you put pen to paper.
読み下す
to read along
読み下すと誤りがわかる
You detect the errors as you read along.

content:
くだす〔降す〕
〈他動〉To subdue (the enemy); to reduce (a castle)

content.content: 敵を降す
to subdue the enemy―subjugate the enemy―bring the enemy to subjection―bring the enemy to his knees
城を降す
to reduce a castle―capture a castle

content:
くだって〔降って〕
〈副〉Down

content.content: 明治維新より降って現今に至るまで
from the Restoration down to the present time
降って小生事無事罷在候間御休神被下度候
As for me, I am all right.

content:
くたばる
〈自動〉To die; to bite the dust; to kick the bucket

content.content: くたばってしまえ
Go to Hell!―Be hanged to you!

content:
くたびれ〔草臥れ〕
〈名〉Fatigue; exhaustion; weariness:(=る) to get tired; to grow weary; to be fatigued; to be exhausted

content.content: 今日は歩いてくたびれた
I am tired with walking.
非常にくたびれた
I am dog-tired.
死ぬほどくたびれた
I am tired to death.
ひどくくたびれてしまった
I am quite done up―used up.
待ちくたびれた
I am weary of waiting.
寝るとくたびれが抜ける
You will sleep off your fatigue.
もうくたびれが抜けた
I have recovered from my fatigue.
骨折り損のくたびれ儲け
I only got laughed at for my pains―I was a fool for my pains.

content:
くだまく〔管捲く〕
〈自動〉To talk incoherently

content.content: 酔ってくだまく
to talk incoherently in one's cups―drink oneself into incoherence

content:
くだもの〔果物〕
〈名〉Fruit(は物質名詞):(普通名詞に用いれば) a fruit, fruits

content.content: 西洋人は果物が好きだ
Foreigners are fond of fruits.
果物は木に生る
Fruit grows on trees―Trees bear fruit.
いろいろの果物が木に生っている
Various fruits grow on the trees.
リンゴは滋養のある果物だ
The apple is a nutritious fruit.
できるだけ多くの果物を食え
Eat as much fruit as you can.
できるだけいろいろの果物を食え
Eat as many fruits as you can.
果物畑
an orchard
果物屋
a fruiterer
果物師
a fruiter

content:
くだらない〔下らない〕
〈形〉Absurd (theory); trivial (matter); nonsensical (story); idle (tale); silly (talk); worthless (fellow, etc.)

content.content: 彼は下らないことばかり言っている
He is always talking nonsense―talking rot.
彼の下らない話しは聞き飽きた
I am tired of listening to his silly talk.
そんな下らない話に耳を貸すものでない
You should not give ear to such idle tales.
あの人は下らない理屈ばかり並べている
He is constantly airing absurd theories.
こんな下らないことで暇をつぶすのは惜しい
I will not waste time over such trivial matters.
こんな下らない物を西洋人に売りつける
They foist such trash on foreigners.

content:
くだり〔下り〕
〈名〉
1. (=上から下へ下ること)descent; going down

content.content: 道は下りだ
The road is downhill.
下りは楽だ
It is easy going downhill.
下り勾配
a down grade―a falling gradient

content: 2. (=都から田舎へ下ること)going down (from town)

content.content: この汽車は上りか下りか
Is the train going up or down?
下りです
It is going down.
下り列車
a down train

content: 3. (=腹下り)diarrhoea; loose bowels

content.content: 下りを止める
to stop the bowels―bind the bowels

content: 4. (=行)a line

content.content: その語は三下り目にある
The word occurs in the third line.
三下り半
a letter of divorce

くだり〔件〕
〈名〉
1. (=前文にあること)the preceding; the above-mentioned
2. (=条)an article; a clause; an item

content:
くだりざか〔下り坂〕
〈名〉
1. (=下り道)a downward slope; a downhill; a descent; a declivity:(鉄道のは) a down grade

content.content: 道は下り坂だ
The road is downhill.
道は下り坂になった
The road is running downhill―The ground is falling―The ground begins to sink.
下り坂は楽だ
It is easy going downhill.

content: 2. (=衰退)decline; ebb; wane

content.content: 彼の運も下り坂だ
His fortunes are declining―His fortunes are on the decline―His star is on the wane.
彼の勢力は下り坂だ
His influence is on the wane.
もう暑さも下り坂だ
The heat is on the ebb―The worst of the heat is over.
あの店も一時は繁昌したものだが今は下り坂になった
The business, once flourishing, is now going downhill.
彼は人生の下り坂だ
He is on the decline of life.
五十の下り坂だ
He is past fifty―gone fifty―turned of fifty―on the shady side of fifty.

content:
くだる〔下る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=おりる)to descend; to go down; to come down; to get down

content.content: 山を下る
to descend a mountain―go down a hill
河を下る
to descend a river―go down a river
階段を下る
to go down the stairs
階段を走り下る
to run down the stairs
演壇を下る
to descend from the platform―leave the platform
馬より下る
to dismount (from a horse)―get off a horse
馬車より下る
to alight from a carriage―get out of a carriage
天より下る
to descend from Heaven
野に下る
to go out of office

content: 2. (=さがる)to fall; to drop

content.content: 寒暖計が五度下った
The thermometer has fallen (by) fine degrees.
零度に下った
The mercury has fallen to zero.
零度以下に下った
The mercury has fallen below zero.

content: 3. (=落ちる)to fall

content.content: 涙はらはらと下る
Tears ran down her cheeks―rolled down her cheeks.

content: 4. (=劣る)to be inferior (to the other)

content.content: これはあれより品質が数等下ります
This is several degrees inferior in quality to that.

content: 5. (=以下なり)to be less than (so many)

content.content: 生徒の数は五千を下らず
The number of students is not less than 5,000.
腹が下る
to be attacked with diarrhoea―have loose bowels
僕は腹が下っている
I have loose bowels―an attack of diarrhoea.
昨夜幾度下ったか
How often did you go to stool last night?
十度下りました
I had ten passages―I went to stool ten times.
腹が下って衰弱した
Diarrhoea has pulled me down.
命令が下る
Orders are given―Orders are issued.
前進の命令が下った
Orders are given to advance.
動員令が下った
Mobilization orders are issued.
都から下る
to go down (from town)
東へ下る
to go down East

content:
くだる〔降る〕
〈自動〉
1. To surrender, submit, yield, captitulate (to the enemy)

content.content: 兜を脱いで軍門に降る(に相当するは)
to lay down one's arms
明治維新より降って現今に至るまで
from the Restoration down to the present
降って小生事無事罷在候間御休神被下度候{くだってしょうせいことぶじいまかりあってそうろうあいだごきゅうしんくだされたくそうろう}
As for me, I am all right.

content:
くだんの〔件の〕
〈形〉(The) said; (the) aforesaid; the above-mentioned; (anything) in question

content.content: 件の人はどうなりましたか
What has become of the man in question?
よって後日のため件の如し
In witness whereof I hereto set my hand and seal for future reference.

content:
くち〔口〕
〈名〉
1. The mouth:(物を言う口) (one's) mouth, lips, tongue:(物を味わう口) (one's) taste, palate
《a》(口が)

content.content: 彼は口がうまい
He is fair-spoken―He has a honeyed tongue.
口がうまいからつい乗せられてしまう
He is so fair-spoken―He has such a honeyed tongue―that you can not help listening to him.
口が達者だ
He is a ready talker―He has a facile tongue.
口が悪い
He has a foul tongue―He is sarcastic.
君はなかなか口が悪いね
You put it strong.
君は口が悪いから人を怒らせるのだ
Your tongue gives offence.
彼は口が軽い
He is a glib talker―He has a glib tongue.
口が重い
He is slow of speech.
口が堅い
He is discreet.
口がまわらぬ
He lisps.
君は口が肥えている
You have a pampered taste.
口が奢っている
You have a dainty palate―You are an epicure.
口がぜいたくだ
You are hard to please in the matter of food.
口が干上がる
to starve―lose one's means of livelihood―lose one's position
そんなことをすると口が干上がってしまう
If you do such a thing, I shall lose my position―It is as much as my position is worth to do such a thing.
(言おうと思っても)口が利けなかった
I could nots peak―I lost my power of speech―My tongue failed me―My tongue clove to the roof of my mouth.
びっくりして口が利けなかった
Astonishment deprived me of my power of speech.
口が滑ったのだ
It was a slip of the tongue.
世間の口がうるさい
People will talk―What will Mrs. Grundy say?
女は口が減らぬ
A woman will have the last word.
皆の口が合う(口が合わぬ)
They (do not) agree in their accounts.
そんなことを言うと口が曲るぞ
Heaven will punish you for saying such a thing.
目を丸くしてあいた口が塞がらぬ
to gape and stare
支那料理は口が焼けるほど熱い
Chinese dishes are served piping-hot.

content: 《b》(口は)

content.content: 口は重宝なもの
A pretext is never wanting.
口は禍の門
“Out of mouth proceeds evil.”
二人口は過ごせるが一人口は過ごせぬ
It costs less to keep two than one―It costs more to keep one than two.

content: 《c》(口に)

content.content: 口に入れる
to put anything into one's mouth
あたら口に茶を入れる
“My thirst is worthy of a better cause.”
口に出す
to mention―speak of―anything
腹にあるけれども口に出せぬ
I can not express what I mean―put my thoughts in words.
腹にあって口に出せぬ智慧
inarticulate wisdom
口には出さないが心で惚れている
I am a lover at heart, if not in profession.
(食物が)口に合う
to suit one's taste―suit one's palate
日本料理はお口に合いますか
Does Japanese food suit your taste?―Do you find Japanese food to your taste?
何かお口に合うものがありそうなものだ
Perhaps I can find something to your taste―something to your liking―something you like―something you fancy.
こんな物はお口に合いますまい
Perhaps you don't like it.
口には合うが腹に合わぬ
I like it, but it does not like me.
口に合うように塩をお入れなさい
Salt it to taste.
口にくわえる
to take anything in one's mouth
犬が何か口にくわえている
The dog has something in his mouth.
犬が何か口にくわえて来た
The dog came with something in his mouth.
口にする
to taste food or drink
僕は酒を口にせぬ
I never taste strong drink.
今日は何も口にせぬ
I have tasted no food today.
彼は始終忠君愛国を口にしている
He always has patriotism and loyalty on his lips.
彼女は彼の名を口にして死んだ
She died with his name on her lips.
口にまかしてしゃべる
to give a loose to one's tongue
彼は口にまかして悪口を言う
He will call you every name he can lay his tongue to.
口に締りが無い
He has a loose tongue―He is indiscreet.
口に税がかからないと思って勝手なことを言う
He has an unbridled tongue.
人の口に乗る
to listen to one
人の口に戸が立てられぬ
People will talk.
こりゃあいた口に牡丹餅だ
It is a godsend―a windfall.
そんな相談ならあいた口に牡丹餅だ
I would jump at such a proposal.
あいた口に牡丹餅は落ちて来ぬ
“Larks do not fall ready-roasted into your mouth.”
ひと口に呑んでしまう
to swallow anything at a mouthful―make a mouthful of anything
ひと口に言えば
In a word,...
ひと口にけなす
to condemn in the gross―condemn in the lump―make a sweeping condemnation
ひと口にそうは言えぬ
The statement is too sweeping.
良薬口に苦し
“Good medicine is bitter to the mouth.”

content: 《d》(口の)

content.content: 口のうまい人だ
He is fair-spoken―He has a honeyed tongue.
口の達者な人だ
He is a ready talker―He has a facile tongue.
口の悪い人だ
He has a foul tongue―He is sarcastic.
口の軽い人だ
He is a glib talker―He has a glib tongue.
口の重い人だ
He is slow of speech.
口の固い若者だ
He is a discreet young man.
口の減らない女だ
She will have the last word.
口のききようも知らない
He does not know how to speak properly.
人の口の端にかかるようなことをするな
Refrain from such conduct as will make people talk about you.
口の中で何か言っている
He mutters something.

content: 《e》(口を)

content.content: 口を開く、口を明く
to open one's mouth―open one's lips
あんぐり口をあく
to open one's mouth wide―gape
彼はめったに口を開かぬ
He seldom opens his mouth―He keeps a grim silence.
口を開けば必ずぶちこわしを言う
He can not open his mouth without putting his foot in it.
口をあいて眺める
to stare with one's mouth open―gape (at anything)
口を閉じる
to shut one's mouth
口をふさぐ
(自分の口なら)to shut one's mouth―put one's hand over one's mouth―(人の口なら)―stop one's mouth―gag one's mouth
口をつぐむ
to shut one's mouth―shut up―hold one's tongue―hold one's peace―keep silence
口をきく
to speak―talk―(仲裁するの意味なら)―mediate between two parties―(口添えをするの意味なら)―put in a good word for one
彼に口をきく者が無い
Nobody will speak to him.
彼は誰にも口をきかぬ
He never speaks to anybody.
彼は僕に口をきいてくれた
He put in a good word for me―said a good word for me.
無駄口を聞く、無駄口をたたく
to chatter―prattle
無駄口をきくな
Do not waste words―“Keep your breath to cool your porridge.”
お前のようなばかには口をきかん
I will not waste words upon you.
口を出す
to interfere in a matter―meddle in anything―put in one's oar
君はこのことに口を出す権利が無い
You have no right to interfere in the matter.
彼は何にでも口を出す
He will meddle in everything―poke his nose into everything―He has an oar in everybody's boat.
横合いから口を出す、口をさしはさむ
to put in a word―interpose
端{はた}から口を出してはいかん
Outsiders must not speak.
口を揃えて攻撃した
They attacked him in a breath.
口を極めて賞める
to extol a person or thing to the skies
世間では口を極めて彼を賞めている
People are loud in his praises―warm in his praises.
口を極めて罵詈する
to abuse one in every key―abuse one in no measured terms
口をすすぐ
to rinse one's mouth
口を拭く
to wipe one's mouth
口を拭う
to pretend to be innocent―feign innocence
熱い茶を飲んで口を焼いた
I drank my tea too hot and burned my mouth―got burnt.
口をとがらす
to make a lip―pout
口を割って飲ませる
to make one drink against one's will
口を過ごす
(自分の口なら)to live―get one's living―(人の口なら)―keep one
口を酸っぱくしてしゃべる
to talk one's tongue weary
女は減らず口をたたく
A woman will have the last word.
口を肥やす
to pamper one's taste
口を滑らす
make a slip of the tongue
口を吸う
to kiss one's lips

content: 《f》(その他)

content.content: 口から泡を吹く
to foam at the mouth
これが彼の口から出た言葉だ
These words fell from his lips.
風説は口から口へと伝わる
Rumours pass from mouth to mouth.
口から先に生れた
His tongue is older than he is.
彼は口から出まかせをしゃべる
He will talk at random.
君の口からそう言うとおかしい
It sounds strange from your lips.
僕の口からこう言うとおかしいがあれは好い子です
She is a good girl, though I say it who should not.
その名が口まで出かかっていた
His name was on the tip of my tongue.
病は口より入る
“Diseases come in at the mouth.”
彼は口と腹が違う
He does not mean what he says―He says one thing and means another.
彼は口ではうまいことを言う
His professions are very fine―He makes fine professions.
口ではとても彼にかなわぬ
I am no match for him in the way of talking―He outtalks me.
口も八丁手も八丁
He speaks and writes with equal facility.
あの人は口ばかりだ
He always talks of doing something without ever doing it―He is all talk and no deed.
彼は口ほど悪くない
He is not so black as he paints himself.
目も口ほどに物を言う
The eyes are more eloquent than the lips.
口と褌は固く締めよ
Keep your own counsel.
死人に口無し
“Dead men tell no tales.”
天に口無し人をもって言わしむ
“The voice of the people is the voice of God.”
この水は口触りが好い
This water is pleasant to the palate―palatable.

content: 2. (=猛獣の口)jaws

content.content: 虎の口に入る
to run into the tiger's jaws
虎の口をのがれる
to be snatched from the jaws of death

content:
3. (=鉄瓶などの口)the spout (of a kettle)
4. (=袋などの口)the mouth (of a bag)

content.content: 君が袋の口を締めているうちは安心だ
All is safe as long as you hold the purse-strings.

content: 5. (=腫物の口)the head (of a tumour)

content.content: できものに口がつく
A boil comes to a bead.

content: 6. (=徳利の口)the mouth (of a bottle)

content.content: 口の大きい徳利
a wide-mouthed bottle

content: 7. (=徳利の栓)a stopper; a cork

content.content: 徳利に口をする
to cork a bottle
徳利の口をあける、口を抜く
to uncork a bottle―draw the cork

content: 8. (=吸口)a mouthpiece

content.content: 口のついた紙巻タバコ
a cigarette with a mouthpiece

content:
9. (=入口、出口)an entrance; an inlet; an outlet; the way out
10. (=壁などの孔)a hole; an opening; an aperture; an orifice

content.content: 口をふさぐ
to stop an opening

content: 11. (=物品の種類)a lot; a brand:(酒なら) a tap

content.content: この口を売ってしまおう
We must clear out this lot.
この口は品切れです
This brand is out of stock.
甘口、辛口
a sweet tap―a dry tap

content: 12. (=品目)an item

content.content: 口分けをする
to state the items

content: 13. (=株)a share

content.content: 一口お入りになりませんか
Won't you take a share?

content: 14. (=緒)the beginning

content.content: 口を切る
to break the ice―broach the subject
お互いに口を切るのを待っている
Each waits for the other to break the ice.

content: 15. (=奉公口)an opening; a position; a place; a berth; a job; employment

content.content: 口を捜す
to seek for employment―look out for an opening―look out for a position―look out for a job
彼は口を捜している
He seeks for employment―He is looking out for a job―He is open for engagement.
口を捜しに上京したのだ
He has come to town in quest of employment.
英語の先生の口を捜している
He is looking out for a position as teacher of English.
英語の先生の口は東京にいくらもある
There are many openings for teachers of English in Tokyo.
口を見つけて上げよう
I will look out a position for you.
口を周旋しよう
I will procure you a position―get you a berth.
好い口があったらお世話を願います
If there is a good opening, I shall request your good offices.
彼はぼくのところへ口を頼みに来た
He applied to me for employment.
彼は口が無くて困っている
He is badly off for employment.
彼は好い口があった
He has found a good place―He is well placed.
口をかける
to offer one a position―(芸者なら)―call a geisha
口がかかる
to have a position offered one―(芸者なら)―be offered an engagement―be called

content:
ぐち〔愚痴〕
〈名〉Grumbling

content.content: 愚痴をこぼす
to grumble
彼は不景気だとかなんだとかかだとか始終愚痴をこぼしている
He is constantly grumbling at the badness of the times, and what not.
長いうちには愚痴も出る
One will grumble once in a while.
愚痴の多い人だ
He is a peevish man―a querulous man.
とんだ愚痴をお聞かせ申しました
You have been good enough to listen to my long story.

くちあい〔口合い〕
〈名〉A pun; a play upon words

content:
くちあけ〔口明け〕
〈名〉The commencement of sale; the first sale

content.content: 今日は口明けだからお安く願っておきます
You shall have it cheap as it is my first transaction today.

content:
くちあたり〔口当り〕
〈名〉Taste

content.content: この水は口当たりが好い
This water is pleasant to the taste―pleasant to the palate―palatable.
洋酒は口当たりが好いから知らず知らず飲んでしまう
Foreign wines are so pleasant to the taste that you are apt to overdrink yourself.

content:
くちいれ〔口入れ〕
〈名〉
1. (=媒介)agency; middlemanship:(=する) to act as agent; to act as middleman (between would-be employer and would-be employed)

content.content: 口入れを頼む
to apply for employment
口入業
agency
口入業者
an agent

content: 2. (=周旋)good offices

content.content: 田中君の口入れで入社しました
I have entered the company's service through (the good offices of) Mr. Tanaka.

くちいれどころ〔口入所〕
〈名〉(英国にては)a servant's agency:(米国にては) an intelligence office; an employment office; a register-office
